text: THE WOMAN OF STONE.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Lurine, was pretty, _petite_, and eighteen. She had a nice
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: situation at the Pharmacie de Siam, in the Rue St. Honore. She had no
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: one dependent upon her, and all the money she earned was her own. Her
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: dress was of cheap material perhaps, but it was cut and fitted with
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that daintiness of perfection which seems to be the natural gift of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Parisienne, so that one never thought of the cheapness, but admired
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: only the effect, which was charming. She was book-keeper and general
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: assistant at the Pharmacie, and had a little room of her own across the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Seine, in the Rue de Lille. She crossed the river twice every day--once
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in the morning when the sun was shining, and again at night when the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: radiant lights along the river's bank glittered like jewels in a long
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: necklace. She had her little walk through the Gardens of the Tuileries
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: every morning after crossing the Pont Royal, but she did not return
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: through the gardens in the evening, for a park in the morning is a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: different thing to a park at night. On her return she always walked
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: along the Rue de Tuileries until she came to the bridge. Her morning
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ramble through the gardens was a daily delight to her, for the Rue de
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Lille is narrow, and not particularly bright, so it was pleasant to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: walk beneath the green trees, to feel the crisp gravel under her feet,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and to see the gleaming white statues in the sunlight, with the sparkle
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: on the round fountain pond, by the side of which she sometimes sat. Her
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: favorite statue was one of a woman that stood on a pedestal near the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Rue de Rivoli. The arm was thrown over her head, and there was a smile
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: on the marble face which was inscrutable. It fascinated the girl as she
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: looked up to it, and seemed to be the morning greeting to her busy
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: day's work in the city. If no one was in sight, which was often the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: case at eight o'clock in the morning, the girl kissed the tips of her
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fingers, and tossed the salute airily up to the statue, and the woman
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of stone always smiled back at her the strange mystical smile which
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: seemed to indicate that it knew much more of this world and its ways
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: than did the little Parisienne who daily gazed up at her.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Lurine was happy, as a matter of course, for was not Paris always
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: beautiful? Did not the sun shine brightly? And was not the air always
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: clear? What more, then, could a young girl wish? There was one thing
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: which was perhaps lacking, but that at last was supplied; and then
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: there was not a happier girl in all Paris than Lurine. She almost cried
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it aloud to her favorite statue the next morning, for it seemed to her
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that the smile had broadened since she had passed it the morning
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: before, and she felt as if the woman of stone had guessed the secret of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the woman of flesh.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Lurine had noticed him for several days hovering about the Pharmacie,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and looking in at her now and then; she saw it all, but pretended not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to see. He was a handsome young fellow with curly hair, and hands long,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: slender, and white as if he were not accustomed to doing hard, manual
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: labor. One night he followed her as far as the bridge, but she walked
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: rapidly on, and he did not overtake her. He never entered the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Pharmacie, but lingered about as if waiting for a chance to speak with
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: her. Lurine had no one to confide in but the woman of stone, and it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: seemed by her smile that she understood already, and there was no need
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to tell her, that the inevitable young man had come. The next night he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: followed her quite across the bridge, and this time Lurine did not walk
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: so quickly. Girls in her position are not supposed to have normal
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: introductions to their lovers, and are generally dependent upon a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: haphazard acquaintance, although that Lurine did not know. The young
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: man spoke to her on the bridge, raising his hat from his black head as
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he did so.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Good evening!" was all he said to her.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: She glanced sideways shyly at him, but did not answer, and the young
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: man walked on beside her.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You come this way every night," he said. "I have been watching you.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Are you offended?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "No," she answered, almost in a whisper.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Then may I walk with you to your home?" he asked.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You may walk with me as far as the corner of the Rue de Lille," she
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: replied.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Thank you!" said the young fellow, and together they walked the short
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: distance, and there he bade her good night, after asking permission to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: meet her at the corner of the Rue St. Honore, and walk home with her,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the next night.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You must not come to the shop," she said.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I understand," he replied, nodding his head in assent to her wishes.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: He told her his name was Jean Duret, and by-and-by she called him Jean,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and he called her Lurine. He never haunted the Pharmacie now, but
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: waited for her at the corner, and one Sunday he took her for a little
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: excursion on the river, which she enjoyed exceedingly. Thus time went
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: on, and Lurine was very happy. The statue smiled its enigmatical smile,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: though, when the sky was overcast, there seemed to her a subtle warning
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in the smile. Perhaps it was because they had quarrelled the night
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: before. Jean had seemed to her harsh and unforgiving. He had asked her
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: if she could not bring him some things from the Pharmacie, and gave her
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: a list of three chemicals, the names of which he had written on a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: paper.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You can easily get them," he had said; "they are in every Pharmacie,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and will never be missed."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "But," said the girl in horror, "that would be stealing."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The young man laughed.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "How much do they pay you there?" he asked. And when she told him, he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: laughed again and said,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Why, bless you, if I got so little as that I would take something from
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the shelves every day and sell it."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The girl looked at him in amazement, and he, angry at her, turned upon
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his heel and left her. She leaned her arms upon the parapet of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bridge, and looked down into the dark water. The river always
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fascinated her at night, and she often paused to look at it when
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: crossing the bridge, shuddering as she did so. She cried a little as
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: she thought of his abrupt departure, and wondered if she had been too
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: harsh with him. After all, it was not very much he had asked her to do,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and they did pay her so little at the Pharmacie. And then perhaps her
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: lover was poor, and needed the articles he had asked her to get.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Perhaps he was ill, and had said nothing. There was a touch on her
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: shoulder. She looked round. Jean was standing beside her, but the frown
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: had not yet disappeared from his brow.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Give me that paper," he said, abruptly.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: She unclosed her hand, and he picked the paper from it, and was turning
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: away.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Stop!" she said, "I will get you what you want, but I will myself put
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the money in the till for what they cost."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: He stood there, looking at her for a moment, and then said--"Lurine, I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: think you are a little fool. They owe you ever so much more than that.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: However, I must have the things," and he gave her back the paper with
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the caution--"Be sure you let no one see that, and be very certain that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you get the right things." He walked with her as far as the corner of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the Rue de Lille. "You are not angry with me?" he asked her before they
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: parted.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

text: old lynx, who looked well after his shop and his pretty little
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: assistant.

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

text: down the jar, and looking sharply at her.

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

text: none, looking straight before her with clear honest eyes, and they

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

text: "Hear her! She confesses!" said the proprietor.

author: Barr, Robert

text: The two concealed officers stepped forward and arrested her where she
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: stood as the accomplice of Jean Duret, who, the night before, had flung
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: a bomb in the crowded Avenue de l'Opera.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Even the prejudiced French judges soon saw that the girl was innocent
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of all evil intent, and was but the victim of the scoundrel who passed
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: by the name of Jean Duret. He was sentenced for life; she was set free.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: He had tried to place the blame on her, like the craven he was, to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: shield another woman. This was what cut Lurine to the heart. She might
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: have tried to find an excuse for his crime, but she realized that he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: had never cared for her, and had but used her as his tool to get
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: possession of the chemicals he dared not buy.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: In the drizzling rain she walked away from her prison, penniless, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: broken in body and in spirit. She passed the little Pharmacie de Siam,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: not daring to enter. She walked in the rain along the Rue des
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Pyramides, and across the Rue de Rivoli, and into the Tuileries
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Gardens. She had forgotten about her stone woman, but, unconsciously
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: her steps were directed to her. She looked up at her statue with
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: amazement, at first not recognizing it. It was no longer the statue of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: a smiling woman. The head was thrown back, the eyes closed. The last
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: mortal agony was on the face. It was a ghastly monument to Death. The
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: girl was so perplexed by the change in her statue that for the moment
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: she forgot the ruin of her own life. She saw that the smiling face was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: but a mask, held in place by the curving of the left arm over it. Life,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: she realized now, was made up of tragedy and comedy, and he who sees
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: but the smiling face, sees but the half of life. The girl hurried on to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the bridge, sobbing quietly to herself, and looked down at the grey
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: river water. The passers-by paid no attention to her. Why, she
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: wondered, had she ever thought the river cold and cruel and merciless?
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It is the only home of the homeless, the only lover that does not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: change. She turned back to the top of the flight of steps which lead
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: down, to the water's brink. She looked toward the Tuileries Gardens,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: but she could not see her statue for the trees which intervened. "I,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: too, will be a woman of stone," she said, as she swiftly descended the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: steps.

text: THE CHEMISTRY OF ANARCHY.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It has been said in the London papers that the dissolution of the Soho
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Anarchist League was caused by want of funds. This is very far from
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: being the case. An Anarchist League has no need for funds and so long
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: as there is money enough to buy beer the League is sure of continued
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: existence. The truth about the scattering of the Soho organization was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: told me by a young newspaper-man who was chairman at the last meeting.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The young man was not an anarchist, though he had to pretend to be one
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in the interests of his paper, and so joined the Soho League, where he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: made some fiery speeches that were much applauded. At last Anarchist
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: news became a drug in the market, and the editor of the paper young
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Marshall Simkins belonged to, told him that he would now have to turn
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his attention to Parliamentary work, as he would print no more
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Anarchist news in the sheet.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: One might think that young Simkins would have been glad to get rid of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his anarchist work, as he had no love for the cause. He was glad to get
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: rid of it, but he found some difficulty in sending in his resignation.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The moment he spoke of resigning, the members became suspicious of him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: He had always been rather better dressed than the others, and, besides,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he drank less beer. If a man wishes to be in good standing in the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: League he must not be fastidious as to dress, and he must be
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: constructed to hold at least a gallon of beer at a sitting. Simkins was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: merely a "quart" man, and this would have told against him all along if
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it had not been for the extra gunpowder he put in his speeches. On
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: several occasions seasoned Anarchists had gathered about him and begged
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: him to give up his designs on the Parliament buildings.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The older heads claimed that, desirable as was the obliteration of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Houses of Parliament, the time was not yet ripe for it. England, they
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: pointed out, was the only place where Anarchists could live and talk
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: unmolested, so, while they were quite anxious that Simkins should go
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and blow up Vienna, Berlin, or Paris, they were not willing for him to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: begin on London. Simkins was usually calmed down with much difficulty,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and finally, after hissing "Cowards!" two or three times under his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: breath, he concluded with, "Oh, very well, then, you know better than I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: do--I am only a young recruit; but allow me at least to blow up
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Waterloo Bridge, or spring a bomb in Fleet Street just to show that we
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: are up and doing."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: But this the Anarchists would not sanction. If he wanted to blow up
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bridges, he could try his hand on those across the Seine. They had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: given their word that there would be no explosions in London so long as
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: England afforded them an asylum.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "But look at Trafalgar Square," cried Simkins angrily; "we are not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: allowed to meet there."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Who wants to meet there?" said the chairman. "It is ever so much more
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: comfortable in these rooms, and there is no beer in Trafalgar Square."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Yes, yes," put in several others; "the time is not yet ripe for it."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Thus was Simkins calmed down, and beer allowed to flow again in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: tranquillity, while some foreign Anarchist, who was not allowed to set
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: foot in his native country, would get up and harangue the crowd in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: broken English and tell them what great things would yet be done by
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: dynamite.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: But when Simkins sent in his resignation a change came over their
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: feelings towards him, and he saw at once that he was a marked man. The
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: chairman, in a whisper, advised him to withdraw his resignation. So
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Simkins, who was a shrewd young fellow, understanding the temper of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: assembly, arose and said:--
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I have no desire to resign, but you do nothing except talk, and I want
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to belong to an Anarchist Society that acts." He stayed away from the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: next meeting, and tried to drop them in that way, but a committee from
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the League called upon him at his lodgings, and his landlady thought
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that young Simkins had got into bad ways when he had such evil-looking
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: men visiting him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Simkins was in a dilemma, and could not make up his mind what to do.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Anarchists apparently were not to be shaken off. He applied to his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: editor for advice on the situation, but that good man could think of no
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: way out of the trouble.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You ought to have known better," he said, "than to mix up with such
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: people."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "But how was I to get the news?" asked Simkins, with some indignation.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The editor shrugged his shoulders. That was not his part of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: business; and if the Anarchists chose to make things uncomfortable for
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the young man, he could not help it.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Simkins' fellow-lodger, a student who was studying chemistry in London,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: noticed that the reporter was becoming gaunt with anxiety.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Simkins," said Sedlitz to him one morning, "you are haggard and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: careworn: what is the matter with you? Are you in love, or is it merely
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: debt that is bothering you?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Neither," replied Simkins.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Then cheer up," said Sedlitz. "If one or the other is not interfering
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: with you, anything else is easily remedied."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I am not so sure of that," rejoined Simkins; and then he sat down and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: told his friend just what was troubling him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Ah," said Sedlitz, "that accounts for it. There has been an unkempt
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ruffian marching up and down watching this house. They are on your
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: track, Simkins, my boy, and when they discover that you are a reporter,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and therefore necessarily a traitor, you will be nabbed some dark
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: night."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Well, that's encouraging," said Simkins, with his head in his hands.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Are these Anarchists brave men, and would they risk their lives in any
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: undertaking?" asked Sedlitz.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, I don't know. They talk enough, but I don't know what they would
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: do. They are quite capable, though, of tripping me up in a dark lane."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Look here," said Sedlitz, "suppose you let me try a plan. Let me give
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: them a lecture on the Chemistry of Anarchy. It's a fascinating
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: subject."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What good would that do?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, wait till you have heard the lecture. If I don't make the hair of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: some of them stand on end, they are braver men than I take them to be.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: We have a large room in Clement's Inn, where we students meet to try
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: experiments and smoke tobacco. It is half club, and half a lecture-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: room. Now, I propose to get those Anarchists in there, lock the doors,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and tell them something about dynamite and other explosives. You give
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: out that I am an Anarchist from America. Tell them that the doors will
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: be locked to prevent police interference, and that there will be a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: barrel of beer. You can introduce me as a man from America, where they
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: know as much about Anarchism in ten minutes as they do here in ten
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: years. Tell them that I have spent my life in the study of explosives.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I will have to make-up a little, but you know that I am a very good
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: amateur actor, and I don't think there will be any trouble about that.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: At the last you must tell them that you have an appointment and will
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: leave me to amuse them for a couple of hours."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "But I don't see what good it is all going to do, though I am
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: desperate," said Simkins, "and willing to try anything. I have thought
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: some of firing a bomb off myself at an Anarchist meeting."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: When the Friday night of meeting arrived the large hall in Clement's
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Inn was filled to the doors. Those assembled there saw a platform at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: one end of the apartment, and a door that led from it to a room at the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: back of the hall. A table was on the platform, and boxes, chemical
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: apparatus, and other scientific-looking paraphernalia were on it. At
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the hour of eight young Simkins appeared before the table alone.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Fellow Anarchists," he said, "you are well aware that I am tired of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the great amount of talk we indulge in, and the little action which
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: follows it. I have been fortunate enough to secure the co-operation of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: an Anarchist from America, who will tell you something of the cause
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: there. We have had the doors locked, and those who keep the keys are
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: now down at the entrance of the Inn, so that if a fire should occur,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: they can quickly come and let us out. There is no great danger of fire,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: however, but the interruption of the police must be guarded against
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: very carefully. The windows, as you see, are shuttered and barred, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: no ray of light can penetrate from this room outside. Until the lecture
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: is over no one can leave the room, and by the same token no one can
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: enter it, which is more to the purpose.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "My friend, Professor Josiah P. Slivers, has devoted his life to the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Chemistry of Anarchy, which is the title of this lecture. He will tell
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you of some important discoveries, which are now to be made known for
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the first time. I regret to say that the Professor is not in a very
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: good state of health, because the line of life which he has adopted has
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: its drawbacks. His left eye has been blown away by a premature
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: explosion during his experiments. His right leg is also permanently
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: disabled. His left arm, as you will notice, is in a sling, having been
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: injured by a little disaster in his workshop since he came to London.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: He is a man, as you will see, devoted body and soul to the cause, so I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: hope you will listen to him attentively. I regret that I am unable to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: remain with you to-night, having other duties to perform which are
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: imperative. I will therefore, if you will permit me, leave by the back
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: entrance after I have introduced the Professor to you."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: At this moment the stumping of a wooden leg was heard, and those in the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: audience saw appear a man on crutches, with one arm in a sling and a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bandage over an eye, although he beamed upon them benevolently with the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: other.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Fellow Anarchists," said Simkins, "allow me to introduce to you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Professor Josiah P. Slivers, of the United States."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Professor bowed and the audience applauded. As soon as the applause
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: began the Professor held up his unmaimed arm and said, "Gentlemen, I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: beg that you will not applaud."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It seems the fashion in America to address a11 sorts and conditions of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: men as "Gentlemen."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Professor continued, "I have here some explosives so sensitive that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the slightest vibration will cause them to go off, and I therefore ask
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you to listen in silence to what I have to say. I must particularly ask
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you also not to stamp on the floor."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Before these remarks were concluded Simkins had slipped out by the back
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: entrance, and somehow his desertion seemed to have a depressing effect
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: upon the company, who looked upon the broken-up Professor with eyes of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: wonder and apprehension.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Professor drew towards him one of the boxes and opened the lid. He
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: dipped his one useful hand into the box and, holding it aloft, allowed
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: something which looked like wet sawdust to drip through his fingers.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "That, gentlemen," he said, with an air of the utmost contempt, "is
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: what is known to the world as dynamite. I have nothing at all to say
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: against dynamite. It has, in its day, been a very powerful medium
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: through which our opinions have been imparted to a listening world, but
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: its day is past. It is what the lumbering stage-coach is to the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: locomotive, what the letter is to the telegram, what the sailing-vessel
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: is to the steamship. It will be my pleasant duty to-night to exhibit to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you an explosive so powerful and deadly that hereafter, having seen
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: what it can accomplish, you will have nothing but derision for such
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: simple and harmless compounds as dynamite and nitro-glycerine."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Professor looked with kindly sympathy over his audience as he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: allowed the yellow mixture to percolate slowly through his fingers back
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: into the box again. Ever and anon he took up a fresh handful and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: repeated the action.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Anarchists in the audience exchanged uneasy glances one with the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: other.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Yet," continued the Professor, "it will be useful for us to consider
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: this substance for a few moments, if but for the purpose of comparison.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Here," he said, diving his hand into another box and bringing up before
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: their gaze a yellow brick, "is dynamite in a compressed form. There is
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: enough here to wreck all this part of London, were it exploded. This
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: simple brick would lay St. Paul's Cathedral in ruins, so, however
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: antiquated dynamite may become, we must always look upon it with
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: respect, just as we look upon reformers of centuries ago who perished
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: for their opinions, even though their opinions were far behind what
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ours are now. I shall take the liberty of performing some experiments
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: with this block of dynamite." Saying which the Professor, with his free
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: arm, flung the block of dynamite far down the aisle, where it fell on
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the floor with a sickening thud. The audience sprang from their seats
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and tumbled back one over the other. A wild shriek went up into the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: air, but the Professor gazed placidly on the troubled mob below him
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: with a superior smile on his face. "I beg you to seat yourselves," he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: said, "and for reasons which I have already explained, I trust that you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: will not applaud any of my remarks. You have just now portrayed one of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the popular superstitions about dynamite, and you show by your actions
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: how necessary a lecture of this sort is in order that you may
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: comprehend thoroughly the substance with which you have to deal. That
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: brick is perfectly harmless, because it is frozen. Dynamite in its
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: frozen state will not explode--a fact well understood by miners and all
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: those who have to work with it, and who, as a rule, generally prefer to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: blow themselves to pieces trying to thaw the substance before a fire.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Will you kindly bring that brick back to me, before it thaws out in the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: heated atmosphere of this room?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: One of the men stepped gingerly forward and picked up the brick,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: holding it far from his body, as he tip-toed up to the platform, where
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he laid it down carefully on the desk before the Professor.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Thank you," said the Professor, blandly.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The man drew a long breath of relief as he went back to his seat.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "That is frozen dynamite," continued the Professor, "and is, as I have
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: said, practically harmless. Now, it will be my pleasure to perform two
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: startling experiments with the unfrozen substance," and with that he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: picked up a handful of the wet sawdust and flung it on a small iron
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: anvil that stood on the table. "You will enjoy these experiments," he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: said, "because it will show you with what ease dynamite may be handled.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It is a popular error that concussion will cause dynamite to explode.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: There is enough dynamite here to blow up this hall and to send into
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: oblivion every person in it, yet you will see whether or not concussion
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: will explode it." The Professor seized a hammer and struck the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: substance on the anvil two or three sharp blows, while those in front
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of him scrambled wildly back over their comrades, with hair standing on
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: end. The Professor ceased his pounding and gazed reproachfully at them;
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: then something on the anvil appeared to catch his eye. He bent over it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and looked critically on the surface of the iron. Drawing himself up to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his full height again, he said,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I was about to reproach you for what might have appeared to any other
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: man as evidence of fear, but I see my mistake. I came very near making
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: a disastrous error. I have myself suffered from time to time from
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: similar errors. I notice upon the anvil a small spot of grease; if my
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: hammer had happened to strike that spot you would all now be writhing
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in your death-agonies under the ruins of this building. Nevertheless,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the lesson is not without its value. That spot of grease is free nitro-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: glycerine that has oozed out from the dynamite. Therein rests, perhaps,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the only danger in handling dynamite. As I have shown you, you can
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: smash up dynamite on an anvil without danger, but if a hammer happened
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to strike a spot of free nitroglycerine it would explode in a moment. I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: beg to apologize to you for my momentary neglect."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: A man rose up in the middle of the hall, and it was some little time
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: before he could command voice enough to speak, for he was shaking as if
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: from palsy. At last he said, after he had moistened his lips several
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: times:--
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Professor, we are quite willing to take your word about the explosive.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: your learning, and would much prefer to hear from your own lips what
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you have to say on the subject, and not have you waste any more
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: before speaking, but I think I voice the sense of the meeting." Cries
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: once more beamed upon them benevolently.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Your confidence in me is indeed touching," he said, "but a chemical
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: lecture without experiments is like a body without a soul. Experiment
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: is the soul of research. In chemistry we must take nothing for granted.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I have shown you how many popular errors have arisen regarding the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: substance with which we are dealing. It would have been impossible for
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: these errors to have arisen if every man had experimented for himself;
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and although I thank you for the mark of confidence you have bestowed
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: upon me, I cannot bring myself to deprive you of the pleasure which my
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: experiments will afford you. There is another very common error to the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: effect that fire will explode dynamite. Such, gentlemen, is not the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: case."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Professor struck a match on his trousers-leg and lighted the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: substance on the anvil. It burnt with a pale bluish flame, and the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Professor gazed around triumphantly at his fellow Anarchists.

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you, for again I have forgotten the small spot of grease. If the flame
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: had reached the spot of nitro-glycerine it would have exploded, as you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: all know. When a man has his thoughts concentrated on one subject he is
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: apt to forget something else. I shall make no more experiments with
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: dynamite. Here, John," he said to the trembling attendant, "take this
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: box away, and move it carefully, for I see that the nitro-glycerine is
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: oozing out. Put it as tenderly down in the next room as if it were a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: relief from the audience.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Now, gentlemen," said the Professor, "we come to the subject that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ought to occupy the minds of all thoughtful men." He smoothed his hair
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: complacently with the palm of his practicable hand, and smiled genially
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: around him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: beverage." The Professor dipped his fingers in his vest pocket and drew
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

text: from here to Charing Cross in one mass of indistinguishable ruins. I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: heir."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "John," he said, turning to his attendant, "bring me a basin of water!"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was on the anvil and putting it with the others.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Now," he said, with a deep sigh, "we can breathe easier. A man can put
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

text: vest-pocket, go to Trafalgar Square, take the pill from the vial, throw

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

text: the four-mile radius, he himself having the glorious privilege of

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: them. The one who uses this must make up his mind to share the fate of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

text: of the room it becomes a deadly poison. We all can live here for the

text: THE FEAR OF IT.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: himself lying on a bed in a clean but scantily furnished room. Through
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: an open window came the roar of the sea, and the thunderous boom of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: passed. The wreck and the struggle with the waves he knew to be real,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: nothing. Stanford looked at her curiously. A fear crept over him that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he was hopelessly crippled for life, and that death was considered
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: preferable to a maimed existence. He felt wearied, though not in pain,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: victim feels it at first.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Are--are any of my--my bones broken, do you know?" he asked.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the beach?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: halo of hair like a glorified golden crown on her head."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "We speak not of our women in words like those," said the nurse,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: severely; "you mean Ruth, perhaps, whose hair is plentiful and yellow."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: pillow.

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: entered.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to the door and fasten it. He feared that these savages, who wished him

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: recover. As he leaned against the bed, he noticed that the door had no
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: made. He staggered to the open window, and looked out. The remnants of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the street--a wooden church such as he had seen in remote American
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in the houses.

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: them as well as he could, and slipped out of the house unnoticed. When
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: both men and women, were working in the fields some distance away.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: She was singing as blithely as a lark until she saw Stanford, whereupon
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: she paused both in her walk and in her song. Stanford, never a backward
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: man, advanced, and was about to greet her when she forestalled him by
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: saying:
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his brow. Seeing that he was annoyed, though why she could not guess,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: does."

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: about not having much time to spare, but she placed the water-cans on
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

text: herself.

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Ah! that also is an island, is it not?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: He laughed at the "also," and remembered that he had some questions to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ask.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Yes, it is an island--also. The sea dashes wrecks on all four sides of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it, but there is no village on its shores so heathenish that if a man
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: is cast upon the beach the inhabitants do not rejoice because he has
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Ruth looked at him with amazement in her eyes.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Is there, then, no religion in England?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Religion? England is the most religious country on the face of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: earth. There are more cathedrals, more churches, more places of worship
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in England than in any other State that I know of. We send missionaries

author: Barr, Robert

text: to all heathenish lands. The Government, itself, supports the Church."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I imagine, then, I mistook your meaning. I thought from what you said
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that the people of England feared death, and did not welcome it or
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: rejoice when one of their number died."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "They do not fear death, and they do not rejoice when it comes. Far from
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it. From the peer to the beggar, everyone fights death as long as he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: can; the oldest cling to life as eagerly as the youngest. Not a man but
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: will spend his last gold piece to ward off the inevitable even for an
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: hour."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The girl took it, and looked at it with keen interest.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and glancing up at him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "That is the general opinion. To accumulate coins like that, men will
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: lie, and cheat, and steal--yes, and work. Although they will give their
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to accumulate gold. Every business in England is formed merely for the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: people are most anxious to belong to."

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: she shuddered, and allowed the yellow coin to slip from her hand to the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ground. "No wonder such a people fears death."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "But would you not be sorry if someone died whom you loved?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "How could we be so selfish? Would you be sorry if your brother, or
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: thing. If one you care for dies you are separated from him, and----"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "But only for a short time, and that gives but another reason for
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: welcoming death. It seems impossible that Christian people should fear
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to enter Heaven. Now I begin to understand why our forefathers left
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: England, and why our teachers will never tell us anything about the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: people there. I wonder why missionaries are not sent to England to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: teach them the truth, and try to civilize the people?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "That would, indeed, be coals to Newcastle. But there comes one of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

text: "I have been receiving," said the young man, coloring slightly, "some
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

text: THE METAMORPHOSES OF JOHNSON.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I was staying for some weeks at a lovely town in the Tyrol which I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: shall take the liberty of naming Schwindleburg. I conceal its real
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: title because it charges what is termed a visitors' tax, and a heavy
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: visitors' tax, exacting the same from me through the medium of my hotel
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bill. The town also made me pay for the excellent band that performs
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: morning and afternoon in the Kurpark. Many continental health resorts
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: support themselves by placing a tax upon visitors, a practice resorted
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to by no English town, and so I regard the imposition as a swindle, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I refuse to advertise any place that practises it. It is true that if
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you stay in Schwindleburg less than a week they do not tax you, but I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: didn't know that, and the hotel man, being wise in his own generation,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: did not present his bill until a day after the week was out, so I found
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: myself in for the visitors' tax and the music money before I was aware
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of it. Thus does a foolish person accumulate wisdom by foreign travel.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I stayed on at this picturesque place, listening to the band every day,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: trying to get value for my money. I intended to keep much to myself,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: having work to do, and make no acquaintances, but I fell under the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fascination of Johnson, thus breaking my rule. What is the use of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: making a rule if you can't have the pleasure of breaking it?
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I think the thing that first attracted me to Johnson was his utter
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: negligence in the matter of his personal appearance. When he stepped down
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: from the hotel 'bus he looked like a semi-respectable tramp. He wore a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: blue woolen shirt, with no collar or necktie. He had a slouch hat, without
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the usual affectation of a Tyrolese feather in it. His full beard had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: evidently not been trimmed for weeks, and he had one trouser-leg turned
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: up. He had no alpenstock, and that also was a merit. So I said to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: myself, "Here is a man free from the conventionalities of society. If I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: become acquainted with anybody it will be with him."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I found Johnson was an American from a Western city named Chicago,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: which I had heard of, and we "palled on." He was very fond of music,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and the band in the Kurpark was a good one, so we went there together
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: twice a day, and talked as we walked up and down the gravel paths. He
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: had been everywhere, and knew his way about; his conversation was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: interesting. In about a week I had come to love Johnson, and I think he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: rather liked me.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: One day, as we returned together to the Hotel Post, he held out his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: hand.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I'm off to-morrow," he said; "off to Innsbruck. So I shall bid you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: good-bye. I am very glad indeed to have met you."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, I'm sorry to hear that." I replied. "But I won't say good-bye now,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I'll see you to the station to-morrow."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "No, don't do that. I shall be away before you are up. We'll say good-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bye here."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: We did, and when I had breakfast next morning I found Johnson had left
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: by the early train. I wandered around the park that forenoon mourning
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: for Johnson. The place seemed lonely without him. In the afternoon I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: explored some of the by-paths of the park within hearing distance of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the band, when suddenly, to my intense surprise, I met my departed
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: friend.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Hello! Johnson," I cried, "I thought you left this morning."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The man looked at me with no recognition in his face.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

text: showed signs of wishing to become acquainted.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I have just arrived," he said, "and know nothing of the place. Have

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert
