title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I have not been informed that there are. I am not a climber myself,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: except by funicular railway. I am always content to take other people's
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: figures for the heights. The only use I have for a mountain is to look
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: at it."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Then Baumgarten launched into a very interesting account of mountain
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: dangers he had passed through. I found him a most entertaining talker,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: almost as fascinating as Johnson himself. He told me he was from
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Hanover, but he had been educated in Great Britain, which accounted for
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his perfect English.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What hotel are you at?" he asked, as the band ceased playing.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I am staying at the Post," I answered. "And you?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I am at the Adler. You must come to dine with me some evening, and I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: will make it even by dining with you. We can thus compare _table
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: d'hotes_."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Baumgarten improved on acquaintance in spite of his foppishness in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: dress. I almost forgot Johnson until one day I was reminded of him one
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: day by Baumgarten saying, "I leave to-night for Innsbruck."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Innsbruck? Why, that's where Johnson is. You ought to meet him. He's
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: an awfully good fellow. A little careless about his clothes, that's
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: all."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I should like to meet him. I know no one in Innsbruck. Do you happen
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to know the name of his hotel?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I do not. I don't even know Johnson's first name. But I'll write you a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: note of introduction on my card, and if you should come across him,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: give him my regards."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Baumgarten accepted the card with thanks, and we parted.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Next day, being warm, I sat on a bench in the shade listening to the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: music. Now that Baumgarten had gone, I was meditating on his strange
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: resemblance to Johnson, and remembering things. Someone sat down beside
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: me, but I paid no attention to him. Finally he said: "This seems to be
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: a very good band."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I started at the sound of his voice, and looked at him too much
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: astonished to reply.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: He wore a moustache, but no whiskers, and a green Tyrolese felt hat
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: with a feather in it. An alpenstock leaned against the bench beside
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: him, its iron point in the gravel. He wore knickerbockers; in fact, his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: whole appearance was that of the conventional mountaineer-tourist. But
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the voice! And the expression of the eyes!
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What did you say?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I said the band is very good."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, yes. Quite so. It's expensive, and it ought to be good. I'm
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: helping to pay for it. By the way, you arrived this morning, I take
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I came last night."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, indeed. And you depart in a few days for Innsbruck?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "No, I go to Salzburg when I leave here."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "And your name isn't Johnson--or--or Baumgarten, by any chance?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It is not."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You come neither from Chicago nor Hanover?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I have never been in America, nor do I know Hanover. Anything else?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Nothing else. It's all right. It's none of my business, of course."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What is none of your business?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Who are you."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, there's no secret about that. I am a Russian. My name is Katzoff.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: At least, these are the first and last syllables of my name. I never
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: use my full name when I travel; it is too complicated."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Thanks. And how do you account for your perfect English? Educated in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: England, I presume? Baumgarten was."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "No, I was not. You know we Russians are reputed to be good linguists."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Yes, I had forgotten that. We will now return to the point from which
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: we started. The band is excellent, and it is about to play one of four
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: favorite selections, Mr. Katzburg."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Katzoff is the name. As to the selection, I don't know much about
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: music, although I am fond of popular pieces."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Katzoff and I got along very nicely, although I did not seem to like
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: him as well as either Johnson or Baumgarten. He left for Salzburg
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: without bidding me good-bye. Missing him one day, I called at the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Angleterre, and the porter told me he had gone.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Next day I searched for him, wondering in what garb I should find him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I passed him twice as he sat on the bench, before I was sure enough to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: accost him. The sacrifice of his moustache had made a remarkable
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: difference. His clean-shaven face caused him to look at least ten years
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: younger. He wore a tall silk hat, and a long black morning coat. I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: found myself hardly able to withdraw my eyes from the white spats that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: partially covered his polished boots. He was reading an English paper,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and did not observe my scrutiny. I approached him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Well, Johnson," I said, "this _is_ a lay out. You're English this
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: time, I suppose?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The man looked up in evident surprise. Fumbling around the front of his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: waistcoat for a moment, he found a black silk string, which he pulled,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bringing to his hand a little round disc of glass. This he stuck in one
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: eye, grimacing slightly to keep it in place, and so regarded me
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: apparently with some curiosity. My certainty that it was Johnson
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: wavered for a moment, but I braved it out.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "That monocle is a triumph, Johnson. In combination with the spats it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: absolutely staggers me. If you had tried that on as Baumgarten I don't
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: know that I should have recognized you. Johnson, what's your game?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You seem to be laboring under some delusion," he said at last. "My
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: name is not Johnson. I am Lord Somerset Campbell, if you care to know."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Really? Oh, well, that's all right. I'm the Duke of Argyll, so we must
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: be relatives. Blood is thicker than water, Campbell. Confess. Whom have
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you murdered?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I knew," said his lordship, slowly, "that the largest lunatic asylum
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in the Tyrol is near here, but I was not aware that the patients were
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: allowed to stroll in the Kurpark."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "That's all very well, Johnson, but----"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Campbell, if you please."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I don't please, as it happens. This masquerade has gone on long
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: enough. What's your crime? Or are you on the other side of the fence?
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Are you practising the detective business?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "My dear fellow, I don't know you, and I resent your impertinent
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: curiosity. Allow me to wish you good-day."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It won't do, Johnson, it has gone too far. You have played on my
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: feelings, and I won't stand it. I'll go to the authorities and relate
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the circumstances. They are just suspicious enough to----"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Which? The authorities or the circumstances?" asked Johnson, sitting
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: down again.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Both, my dear boy, both, and you know it. Now, Johnson, make a clean
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: breast of it, I won't give you away."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Johnson sighed, and his glass dropped from his eye. He looked around
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: cautiously. "Sit down," he said.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Then you _are_ Johnson!" I cried, with some exultation.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I thought you weren't very sure," began Johnson. "However, it doesn't
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: matter, but you should be above threatening a man. That was playing it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: low down."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I see you're from Chicago. Go on."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It's all on account of this accursed visitors' tax. That I decline to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: pay. I stay just under the week at a hotel, and then take a 'bus to the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: station, and another 'bus to another hotel. Of course my mistake was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: getting acquainted with you. I never suspected you were going to stay
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: here a month."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "But why didn't you let me know? Your misdemeanor is one I thoroughly
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: sympathize with. I wouldn't have said anything."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Johnson shook his head.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I took a fellow into my confidence once before. He told it as a dead
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: secret to a friend, and the friend thought it a good joke, and related
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it, always under oath that it should go no further. The authorities had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: me arrested before the week was out, and fined me heavily besides
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: exacting the tax."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "But doesn't the 'bus fares, the changing, and all that amount to as
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: much as the tax?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I suppose it does. It isn't the money I object to, it's the principle
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of the thing."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: This interview was the last I ever had with Johnson. About a week later
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I read in the Visitors' List that Lord Somerset Campbell, who had been
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: a guest of the Victoria (the swell hotel of the place), had left
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Schwindleburg for Innsbruck.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: THE RECLAMATION OF JOE HOLLENDS.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The public-houses of Burwell Road--and there were many of them for the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: length of the street--were rather proud of Joe Hollends. He was a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: perfected specimen of the work a pub produces. He was probably the most
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: persistent drunkard the Road possessed, and the periodical gathering in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of Joe by the police was one of the stock sights of the street. Many of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the inhabitants could be taken to the station by one policeman; some
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: required two; but Joe's average was four. He had been heard to boast
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that on one occasion he had been accompanied to the station by seven
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bobbies, but that was before the force had studied Joe and got him down
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to his correct mathematical equivalent. Now they tripped him up, a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: policeman taking one kicking leg and another the other, while the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: remaining two attended to the upper part of his body. Thus they carried
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: him, followed by an admiring crowd, and watched by other envious
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: drunkards who had to content themselves with a single officer when they
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: went on a similar spree. Sometimes Joe managed to place a kick where it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: would do the most good against the stomach of a policeman, and when the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: officer rolled over there was for a few moments a renewal of the fight,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: silent on the part of the men and vociferous on the part of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: drunkard, who had a fine flow of abusive language. Then the procession
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: went on again. It was perfectly useless to put Joe on the police
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ambulance, for it required two men to sit on him while in transit, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the barrow is not made to stand such a load.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Of course, when Joe staggered out of the pub and fell in the gutter,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the ambulance did its duty, and trundled Joe to his abiding place, but
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the real fun occurred when Joe was gathered in during the third stage
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of his debauch. He passed through the oratorical stage, then the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: maudlin or sentimental stage, from which he emerged into the fighting
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: stage, when he was usually ejected into the street, where he forthwith
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: began to make Rome howl, and paint the town red. At this point the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: policeman's whistle sounded, and the force knew Joe was on the warpath,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and that duty called them to the fray.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It was believed in the neighborhood that Joe had been a college man,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and this gave him additional standing with his admirers. His eloquence
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was undoubted, after several glasses varying in number according to the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: strength of their contents, and a man who had heard the great political
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: speakers of the day admitted that none of them could hold a candle to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Joe when he got on the subject of the wrongs of the working man and the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: tyranny of the capitalist. It was generally understood that Joe might
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: have been anything he liked, and that he was no man's enemy but his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: own. It was also hinted that he could tell the bigwigs a thing or two
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: if he had been consulted in affairs of State.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: One evening, when Joe was slowly progressing as usual, with his feet in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the air, towards the station, supported by the requisite number of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: policemen, and declaiming to the delight of the accompanying crowd, a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: woman stood with her back to the brick wall, horror-stricken at the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: sight. She had a pale, refined face, and was dressed in black. Her
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: self-imposed mission was among these people, but she had never seen Joe
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: taken to the station before, and the sight, which was so amusing to the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: neighborhood, was shocking to her. She enquired about Joe, and heard
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the usual story that he was no man's enemy but his own, although they
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: might in justice have added the police. Still, a policeman was hardly
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: looked upon as a human being in that neighborhood. Miss Johnson
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: reported the case to the committee of the Social League, and took
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: counsel. Then it was that the reclamation of Joe Hollends was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: determined on.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Joe received Miss Johnson with subdued dignity, and a demeanor that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: delicately indicated a knowledge on his part of her superiority and his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: own degradation. He knew how a lady should be treated even if he was a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: drunkard, as he told his cronies afterwards. Joe was perfectly willing
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to be reclaimed. Heretofore in his life, no one had ever extended the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: hand of fellowship to him. Human sympathy was what Joe needed, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: precious little he had had of it. There were more kicks than halfpence
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in this world for a poor man. The rich did not care what became of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: poor; not they--a proposition which Miss Johnson earnestly denied.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It was one of the tenets of the committee that where possible the poor
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: should help the poor. It was resolved to get Joe a decent suit of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: clothes and endeavor to find him a place where work would enable him to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: help himself. Miss Johnson went around the neighborhood and collected
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: pence for the reclamation. Most people were willing to help Joe,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: although it was generally felt that the Road would be less gay when he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: took on sober habits. In one room, however, Miss Johnson was refused
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the penny she pleaded for.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "We cannot spare even a penny," said the woman, whose sickly little boy
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: clung to her skirts. "My husband is just out of work again. He has had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: only four weeks' work this time."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Miss Johnson looked around the room and saw why there was no money. It
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was quite evident where the earnings of the husband had gone.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The room was much better furnished than the average apartment of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: neighborhood. There were two sets of dishes where one would have been
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: quite sufficient. On the mantelshelf and around the walls were various
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: unnecessary articles which cost money.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Miss Johnson noted all this but said nothing, although she resolved to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: report it to the committee. In union is strength and in multitude of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: counsel there is wisdom. Miss Johnson had great faith in the wisdom of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the committee.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "How long has your husband been out of work?" she asked.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Only a few days, but times are very bad and he is afraid he will not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: get another situation soon."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What is his trade?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "He is a carpenter and a good workman--sober and steady."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "If you give me his name I will put it down in our books. Perhaps we
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: may be able to help him."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "John Morris is his name."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Miss Johnson wrote it down on her tablets, and when she left, the wife
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: felt vaguely grateful for benefits to come.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The facts of the case were reported to the committee, and Miss Johnson
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was deputed to expostulate with Mrs. Morris upon her extravagance. John
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Morris's name was put upon the books among the names of many other
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: unemployed persons. The case of Joe Hollends then came up, and elicited
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: much enthusiasm. A decent suit of clothing had been purchased with part
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of the money collected for him, and it was determined to keep the rest
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in trust, to be doled out to him as occasion warranted.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Two persuasive ladies undertook to find a place for him in one of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: factories, if such a thing were possible.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Joe felt rather uncomfortable in his new suit of clothes, and seemed to
title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

text: When Mr. Denham left his office and went out into the street everything
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: had an unusual appearance to him. He walked along, unheeding the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: direction. He looked at the fine residences and realized that he might
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: have a fine residence if he wanted it. He saw handsome carriages; he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: too might set up an equipage. The satisfaction these thoughts produced
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was brief. Of what use would a fine house or an elegant carriage be to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: carriage. He began to realize how utterly alone in the world he was. He
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: had no friends, no acquaintances even. The running dog, with its nose
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to the ground, sees nothing of the surrounding scenery. He knew men in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: shoulders and say to him, "Invite me to your house; I am lonely; I want
title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: himself. He was familiar with the counting-room and its language, but
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the drawing-room was an unexplored country to him, where an unknown
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: tongue was spoken. On the road to wealth he had missed something, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it was now too late to go back for it. Only the day before, he had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: her white fingers to the former instrument. Richard Denham sat down
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

text: no capital into the business?"
title: The Face and the Mask

text: to do--that is, if you want my advice."

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
