text: achievements of the past fifty years, and if I venture to call
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: attention to the fact, now apparently forgotten, that the people of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: 19th century succeeded in accomplishing many notable things, it must
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: not be imagined that I intend thereby to discount in any measure the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: marvellous inventions of the present age. Men have always been somewhat
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: prone to look with a certain condescension upon those who lived fifty
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: or a hundred years before them. This seems to me the especial weakness
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of the present age; a feeling of national self-conceit, which, when it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: exists, should at least be kept as much in the background as possible.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It will astonish many to know that such also was a failing of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: people of the 19th century. They imagined themselves living in an age
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of progress, and while I am not foolish enough to attempt to prove that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: they did anything really worth recording, yet it must be admitted by
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: any unprejudiced man of research that their inventions were at least
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: stepping-stones to those of to-day. Although the telephone and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: telegraph, and all other electrical appliances, are now to be found
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: only in our national museums, or in the private collections of those
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: few men who take any interest in the doings of the last century,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: nevertheless, the study of the now obsolete science of electricity led
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: up to the recent discovery of vibratory ether which does the work of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the world so satisfactorily. The people of the 19th century were not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fools, and although I am well aware that this statement will be
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: received with scorn where it attracts any attention whatever, yet who
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: can say that the progress of the next half-century may not be as great
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: as that of the one now ended, and that the people of the next century
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: may not look upon us with the same contempt which we feel toward those
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: who lived fifty years ago?
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Being an old man, I am, perhaps, a laggard who dwells in the past
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: rather than the present; still, it seems to me that such an article as
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that which appeared recently in _Blackwood_ from the talented pen
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of Prof. Mowberry, of Oxford University, is utterly unjustifiable.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Under the title of "Did the People of London Deserve their Fate?" he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: endeavors to show that the simultaneous blotting out of millions of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: human beings was a beneficial event, the good results of which we still
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: enjoy. According to him, Londoners were so dull-witted and stupid, so
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: incapable of improvement, so sodden in the vice of mere money-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: gathering, that nothing but their total extinction would have sufficed,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and that, instead of being an appalling catastrophe, the doom of London
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was an unmixed blessing. In spite of the unanimous approval with which
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: this article has been received by the press, I still maintain that such
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: writing is uncalled for, and that there is something to be said for the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: London of the 19th century.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: II.--WHY LONDON, WARNED, WAS UNPREPARED.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The indignation I felt in first reading the article alluded to still
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: remains with me, and it has caused me to write these words, giving some
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: account of what I must still regard, in spite of the sneers of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: present age, as the most terrible disaster that ever overtook a portion
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of the human race. I shall not endeavor to place before those who read,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: any record of the achievements pertaining to the time in question. But
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I would like to say a few words about the alleged stupidity of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: people of London in making no preparations for a disaster regarding
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: which they had continual and ever-recurring warning. They have been
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: compared with the inhabitants of Pompeii making merry at the foot of a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: volcano. In the first place, fogs were so common in London, especially
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in winter, that no particular attention was paid to them. They were
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: merely looked upon as inconvenient annoyances, interrupting traffic and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: prejudicial to health, but I doubt if anyone thought it possible for a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fog to become one vast smothering mattress pressed down upon a whole
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: metropolis, extinguishing life as if the city suffered from hopeless
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: hydrophobia. I have read that victims bitten by mad dogs were formerly
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: put out of their sufferings in that way, although I doubt much if such
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: things were ever actually done, notwithstanding the charges of savage
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: barbarity now made against the people of the 19th century.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Probably, the inhabitants of Pompeii were so accustomed to the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: eruptions of Vesuvius that they gave no thought to the possibility of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: their city being destroyed by a storm of ashes and an overflow of lava.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Rain frequently descended upon London, and if a rainfall continued long
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: enough it would certainly have flooded the metropolis, but no
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: precautions were taken against a flood from the clouds. Why, then,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: should the people have been expected to prepare for a catastrophe from
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fog, such as there had never been any experience of in the world's
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: history? The people of London were far from being the sluggish dolts
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: present-day writers would have us believe.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: III.--THE COINCIDENCE THAT CAME AT LAST.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: As fog has now been abolished both on sea and land, and as few of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: present generation have even seen one, it may not be out of place to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: give a few lines on the subject of fogs in general, and the London fogs
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in particular, which through local peculiarities differed from all
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: others. A fog was simply watery vapor rising from the marshy surface of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the land or from the sea, or condensed into a cloud from the saturated
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: atmosphere. In my day, fogs were a great danger at sea, for people then
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: travelled by means of steamships that sailed upon the surface of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ocean.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: London at the end of the 19th century consumed vast quantities of a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: soft bituminous coal for the purpose of heating rooms and of preparing
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: food. In the morning and during the day, clouds of black smoke were
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: poured forth from thousands of chimneys. When a mass of white vapor
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: arose in the night these clouds of smoke fell upon the fog, pressing it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: down, filtering slowly through it, and adding to its density. The sun
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: would have absorbed the fog but for the layer of smoke that lay thick
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: above the vapor and prevented the rays reaching it. Once this condition
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of things prevailed, nothing could clear London but a breeze of wind
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: from any direction. London frequently had a seven days' fog, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: sometimes a seven days' calm, but these two conditions never coincided
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: until the last year of the last century. The coincidence, as everyone
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: knows, meant death--death so wholesale that no war the earth has ever
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: seen left such slaughter behind it. To understand the situation, one
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: has only to imagine the fog as taking the place of the ashes at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Pompeii, and the coal-smoke as being the lava that covered it. The
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: result to the inhabitants in both cases was exactly the same.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: IV.--THE AMERICAN WHO WANTED TO SELL.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I was at the time confidential clerk to the house of Fulton, Brixton &
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Co., a firm in Cannon Street, dealing largely in chemicals and chemical
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: apparatus. Fulton I never knew; he died long before my time. Sir John
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Brixton was my chief, knighted, I believe, for services to his party,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: or because he was an official in the City during some royal progress
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: through it; I have forgotten which. My small room was next to his large
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: one, and my chief duty was to see that no one had an interview with Sir
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: John unless he was an important man or had important business. Sir John
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was a difficult man to see, and a difficult man to deal with when he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was seen. He had little respect for most men's feelings, and none at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: all for mine. If I allowed a man to enter his room who should have been
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: dealt with by one of the minor members of the company, Sir John made no
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: effort to conceal his opinion of me. One day, in the autumn of the last
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: year of the century, an American was shown into my room. Nothing would
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: do but he must have an interview with Sir John Brixton. I told him that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it was impossible, as Sir John was extremely busy, but that if he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: explained his business to me I would lay it before Sir John at the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: first favorable opportunity. The American demurred at this, but finally
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: accepted the inevitable. He was the inventor, he said, of a machine
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that would revolutionize life in London, and he wanted Fulton, Brixton
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: & Co. to become agents for it. The machine, which he had in a small
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: handbag with him, was of white metal, and it was so constructed that by
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: turning an index it gave out greater or less volumes of oxygen gas. The
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: gas, I understood, was stored in the interior in liquid form under
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: great pressure, and would last, if I remember rightly, for six months
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: without recharging. There was also a rubber tube with a mouthpiece
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: attached to it, and the American said that if a man took a few whiffs a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: day, he would experience beneficial results. Now, I knew there was not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the slightest use in showing the machine to Sir John, because we dealt
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in old-established British apparatus, and never in any of the new-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fangled Yankee contraptions. Besides, Sir John had a prejudice against
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Americans, and I felt sure this man would exasperate him, as he was a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: most cadaverous specimen of the race, with high nasal tones, and a most
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: deplorable pronunciation, much given to phrases savoring of slang; and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he exhibited also a certain nervous familiarity of demeanor towards
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: people to whom he was all but a complete stranger. It was impossible
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: for me to allow such a man to enter the presence of Sir John Brixton,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and when he returned some days later I explained to him, I hope with
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: courtesy, that the head of the house regretted very much his inability
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to consider his proposal regarding the machine. The ardor of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: American seemed in no way dampened by this rebuff. He said I could not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: have explained the possibilities of the apparatus properly to Sir John;
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he characterized it as a great invention, and said it meant a fortune
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to whoever obtained the agency for it. He hinted that other noted
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: London houses were anxious to secure it, but for some reason not stated
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he preferred to deal with us. He left some printed pamphlets referring
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to the invention, and said he would call again.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: V.--THE AMERICAN SEES SIR JOHN.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Many a time I have since thought of that persistent American, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: wondered whether he left London before the disaster, or was one of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: unidentified thousands who were buried in unmarked graves. Little did
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Sir John think when he expelled him with some asperity from his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: presence, that he was turning away an offer of life, and that the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: heated words he used were, in reality, a sentence of death upon
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: himself. For my own part, I regret that I lost my temper, and told the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: American his business methods did not commend themselves to me. Perhaps
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he did not feel the sting of this; indeed, I feel certain he did not,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: for, unknowingly, he saved my life. Be that as it may, he showed no
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: resentment, but immediately asked me out to drink with him, an offer I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was compelled to refuse. But I am getting ahead of my story. Indeed,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: being unaccustomed to writing, it is difficult for me to set down
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: events in their proper sequence. The American called upon me several
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: times after I told him our house could not deal with him. He got into
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the habit of dropping in upon me unannounced, which I did not at all
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: like, but I gave no instructions regarding his intrusions, because I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: had no idea of the extremes to which he was evidently prepared to go.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: One day, as he sat near my desk reading a paper, I was temporarily
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: called from the room. When I returned I thought he had gone, taking his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: machine with him, but a moment later I was shocked to hear his high
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: nasal tones in Sir John's room alternating with the deep notes of my
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: chief's voice, which apparently exercised no such dread upon the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: American as upon those who were more accustomed to them. I at once
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: entered the room, and was about to explain to Sir John that the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: American was there through no connivance of mine, when my chief asked
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: me to be silent, and, turning to his visitor, gruffly requested him to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: proceed with his interesting narration. The inventor needed no second
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: invitation, but went on with his glib talk, while Sir John's frown grew
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: deeper, and his face became redder under his fringe of white hair. When
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the American had finished, Sir John roughly bade him begone, and take
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his accursed machine with him. He said it was an insult for a person
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: with one foot in the grave to bring a so-called health invention to a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: robust man who never had a day's illness, I do not know why he listened
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: so long to the American, when he had made up his mind from the first
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: not to deal with him, unless it was to punish me for inadvertently
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: allowing the stranger to enter. The interview distressed me
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: exceedingly, as I stood there helpless, knowing Sir John was becoming
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: more and more angry with every word the foreigner uttered, but, at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: last, I succeeded in drawing the inventor and his work into my own room
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and closing the door. I sincerely hoped I would never see the American
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: again, and my wish was gratified. He insisted on setting his machine
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: going, and placing it on a shelf in my room. He asked me to slip it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: into Sir John's room some foggy day and note the effect. The man said
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he would call again, but he never did.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: VI.--HOW THE SMOKE HELD DOWN THE FOG.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It was on a Friday that the fog came down upon us. The weather was very
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fine up to the middle of November that autumn. The fog did not seem to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: have anything unusual about it. I have seen many worse fogs than that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: appeared to be. As day followed day, however, the atmosphere became
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: denser and darker, caused, I suppose, by the increasing volume of coal-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: smoke poured out upon it. The peculiarity about those seven days was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the intense stillness of the air. We were, although we did not know it,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: under an air-proof canopy, and were slowly but surely exhausting the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: life-giving oxygen around us, and replacing it by poisonous carbonic
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: acid gas. Scientific men have since showed that a simple mathematical
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: calculation might have told us exactly when the last atom of oxygen
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: would have been consumed; but it is easy to be wise after the event.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The body of the greatest mathematician in England was found in the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Strand. He came that morning from Cambridge. During the fog there was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: always a marked increase in the death rate, and on this occasion the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: increase was no greater than usual until the sixth day. The newspapers
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: on the morning of the seventh were full of startling statistics, but at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the time of going to press the full significance of the alarming figures
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was not realized. The editorials of the morning papers on the seventh
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: day contained no warning of the calamity that was so speedily to follow
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: their appearance. I lived then at Ealing, a Western suburb of London,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and came every morning to Cannon Street by a certain train. I had up to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the sixth day experienced no inconvenience from the fog, and this was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: largely due, I am convinced, to the unnoticed operations of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: American machine.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: On the fifth and sixth days Sir John did not come to the City, but he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was in his office on the seventh. The door between his room and mine
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was closed. Shortly after ten o'clock I heard a cry in his room,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: followed by a heavy fall. I opened the door, and saw Sir John lying
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: face downwards on the floor. Hastening towards him, I felt for the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: first time the deadly effect of the deoxygenized atmosphere, and before
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I reached him I fell first on one knee and then headlong. I realized
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that my senses were leaving me, and instinctively crawled back to my
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: own room, where the oppression was at once lifted, and I stood again
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: upon my feet, gasping. I closed the door of Sir John's room, thinking
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it filled with poisonous fumes, as, indeed, it was. I called loudly for
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: help, but there was no answer. On opening the door to the main office I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: met again what I thought was the noxious vapor. Speedily as I closed
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the door, I was impressed by the intense silence of the usually busy
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: office, and saw that some of the clerks were motionless on the floor,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and others sat with their heads on their desks as if asleep. Even at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: this awful moment I did not realize that what I saw was common to all
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: London, and not, as I imagined, a local disaster, caused by the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: breaking of some carboys in our cellar. (It was filled with chemicals
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of every kind, of whose properties I was ignorant, dealing as I did
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: with the accountant, and not the scientific side of our business.) I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: opened the only window in my room, and again shouted for help. The
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: street was silent and dark in the ominously still fog, and what now
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: froze me with horror was meeting the same deadly, stifling atmosphere
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that was in the rooms. In falling I brought down the window, and shut
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: out the poisonous air. Again I revived, and slowly the true state of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: things began to dawn upon me.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I was in an oasis of oxygen. I at once surmised that the machine on my
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: shelf was responsible for the existence of this oasis in a vast desert
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of deadly gas. I took down the American's machine, fearful in moving it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that I might stop its working. Taking the mouthpiece between my lips I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: again entered Sir John's room, this time without feeling any ill
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: effects. My poor master was long beyond human help. There was evidently
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: no one alive in the building except myself. Out in the street all was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: silent and dark. The gas was extinguished, but here and there in shops
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the incandescent lights were still weirdly burning, depending, as they
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: did, on accumulators, and not on direct engine power. I turned
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: automatically towards Cannon Street Station, knowing my way to it even
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: if blindfolded, stumbling over bodies prone on the pavement, and in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: crossing the street I ran against a motionless 'bus, spectral in the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fog, with dead horses lying in front, and their reins dangling from the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: nerveless hand of a dead driver. The ghostlike passengers, equally
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: silent, sat bolt upright, or hung over the edge boards in attitudes
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: horribly grotesque.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: VII.--THE TRAIN WITH ITS TRAIL OF THE DEAD.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: If a man's reasoning faculties were alert at such a time (I confess
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: mine were dormant), he would have known there could be no trains at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Cannon Street Station, for if there was not enough oxygen in the air to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: keep a man alive, or a gas-jet alight, there would certainly not be
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: enough to enable an engine fire to burn, even if the engineer retained
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: sufficient energy to attend to his task. At times instinct is better
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: than reason, and it proved so in this case. The railway from Ealing in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: those days came under the City in a deep tunnel. It would appear that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in this underground passage the carbonic acid gas would first find a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: resting-place on account of its weight; but such was not the fact. I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: imagine that a current through the tunnel brought from the outlying
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: districts a supply of comparatively pure air that, for some minutes
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: after the general disaster, maintained human life. Be this as it may,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the long platforms of Cannon Street Underground Station presented a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fearful spectacle. A train stood at the down platform. The electric
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: lights burned fitfully. This platform was crowded with men, who fought
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: each other like demons, apparently for no reason, because the train was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: already packed as full as it could hold. Hundreds were dead under foot,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and every now and then a blast of foul air came along the tunnel,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: whereupon hundreds more would relax their grips, and succumb. Over
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: their bodies the survivors fought, with continually thinning ranks. It
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: seemed to me that most of those in the standing train were dead.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Sometimes a desperate body of fighters climbed over those lying in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: heaps and, throwing open a carriage door, hauled out passengers already
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in, and took their places, gasping. Those in the train offered no
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: resistance, and lay motionless where they were flung, or rolled
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: helplessly under the wheels of the train. I made my way along the wall
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: as well as I could to the engine, wondering why the train did not go.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The engineer lay on the floor of his cab, and the fires were out.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Custom is a curious thing. The struggling mob, fighting wildly for
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: places in the carriages, were so accustomed to trains arriving and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: departing that it apparently occurred to none of them that the engineer
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was human and subject to the same atmospheric conditions as themselves.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I placed the mouthpiece between his purple lips, and, holding my own
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: breath like a submerged man, succeeded in reviving him. He said that if
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I gave him the machine he would take out the train as far as the steam
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: already in the boiler would carry it. I refused to do this, but stepped
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: on the engine with him, saying it would keep life in both of us until
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: we got out into better air. In a surly manner he agreed to this and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: started the train, but he did not play fair. Each time he refused to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: give up the machine until I was in a fainting condition with holding in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: my breath, and, finally, he felled me to the floor of the cab. I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: imagine that the machine rolled off the train as I fell and that he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: jumped after it. The remarkable thing is that neither of us needed the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: machine, for I remember that just after we started I noticed through
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the open iron door that the engine fire suddenly became aglow again,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: although at the time I was in too great a state of bewilderment and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: horror to understand what it meant. A western gale had sprung up--an
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: hour too late. Even before we left Cannon Street those who still
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: survived were comparatively safe, for one hundred and sixty-seven
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: persons were rescued from that fearful heap of dead on the platforms,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: although many died within a day or two after, and others never
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: recovered their reason. When I regained my senses after the blow dealt
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: by the engineer, I found myself alone, and the train speeding across
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the Thames near Kew. I tried to stop the engine, but did not succeed.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: However, in experimenting, I managed to turn on the air brake, which in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: some degree checked the train, and lessened the impact when the crash
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: came at Richmond terminus. I sprang off on the platform before the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: engine reached the terminal buffers, and saw passing me like a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: nightmare the ghastly trainload of the dead. Most of the doors were
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: swinging open, and every compartment was jammed full, although, as I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: afterwards learned, at each curve of the permanent way, or extra lurch
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of the train, bodies had fallen out all along the line. The smash at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Richmond made no difference to the passengers. Besides myself, only two
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: persons were taken alive from the train, and one of these, his clothes
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: torn from his back in the struggle was sent to an asylum, where he was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: never able to tell who he was; neither, as far as I know, did anyone
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ever claim him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: THE PREDICAMENT OF DE PLONVILLE.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: This story differs from others in having an assortment of morals. Most
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: stories have one moral; here are several. The moral usually appears at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the end--in this case a few are mentioned at the beginning, so that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: they may be looked out for as the reading progresses. First: it is well
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: for a man--especially a young man--to attend to his own business.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Second: in planning a person's life for some little distance ahead, it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: will be a mistake if an allowance of ten per cent. at least, is not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: made for that unknown quantity--woman. Third: it is beneficial to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: remember that one man rarely knows everything. Other morals will
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: doubtless present themselves, and at the end the cynically-inclined
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: person may reflect upon the adage about the frying-pan and the fire.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Young M. de Plonville of Paris enjoyed a most enviable position. He had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: all the money he needed, which is quite a different thing from saying
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he had all the money he wanted. He was well educated, and spoke three
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: languages, that is, he spoke his own well and the other two badly, but
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: as a man always prides himself on what he is least able to do, De
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Plonville fancied himself a linguist. His courage in speaking English
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to Englishmen and German to Germans showed that he was, at least, a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: brave man. There was a great deal of good and even of talent in De
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Plonville. This statement is made at the beginning, because everyone
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: who knows De Plonville will at once unhesitatingly contradict it. His
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: acquaintances thought him one of the most objectionable young men in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Paris, and naval officers, when his name was mentioned, usually gave
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: themselves over to strong and unjustifiable language. This was all on
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: account of De Plonville's position, which, although enviable had its
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: drawbacks.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: His rank in the navy was such that it entitled him to no consideration
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: whatever, but, unfortunately for his own popularity, De Plonville had a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: method of giving force to his suggestions. His father was a very big
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: man in the French Government. He was so big a man that he could send a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: censure to the commander of a squadron in the navy, and the commander
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: dare not talk back. It takes a very big man indeed to do this, and that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was the elder De Plonville's size. But then it was well known that the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: elder De Plonville was an easy-going man who loved comfort, and did not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: care to trouble himself too much about the navy in his charge, and so
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: when there was trouble, young De Plonville got the credit of it;
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: consequently, the love of the officers did not flow out to him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Often young De Plonville's idiotic impetuosity gave color to these
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: suspicions. For instance, there is the well-known Toulon incident. In a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: heated controversy young De Plonville had claimed that the firing of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the French ironclads was something execrable, and that the whole fleet
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: could not hold their own at the cannon with any ten of the British
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: navy. Some time after, the naval officers learned that the Government
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: at Paris was very much displeased with the inaccurate gun practice of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the fleet, and the hope was expressed that the commander would see his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: way to improving it. Of course, the officers could do nothing but gnash
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: their teeth, try to shoot better, and hope for a time to come when the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Government then in power would be out, and they could find some
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: tangible pretence for hanging young De Plonville from the yard-arm.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: All this has only a remote bearing upon this story, but we now come to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: a matter on which the story sinks or swims. De Plonville had a secret--
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: not such a secret as is common in Parisian life, but one entirely
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: creditable to him. It related to an invention intended to increase the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: efficiency of the French army. The army being a branch of the defences
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of his country with which De Plonville had nothing whatever to do, his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: attention naturally turned towards it. He spoke of this invention,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: once, to a friend, a lieutenant in the army. He expected to get some
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: practical suggestions. He never mentioned it again to anyone.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It is based on the principle of the umbrella," he said to his friend;
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "in fact, it was the umbrella that suggested it to me. If it could be
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: made very light so as not to add seriously to the impedimenta at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: present carried by the soldier, it seems to me it would be exceedingly
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: useful. Instead of being circular as an umbrella is, it must be oblong
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: with sharp ends. It would have to be arranged so as to be opened and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: closed quickly, with the cloth thin, but impervious to water. When the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: army reached a river each soldier could open this, place it in the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: water, enter it with some care, and then paddle himself across with the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: butt-end of his gun, or even with a light paddle, if the carrying of it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: added but little to the weight, thus saving the building of temporary
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bridges. It seems to me such an invention ought to be of vast use in a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: forced march. Then at night it might be used as a sort of tent, or in a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: heavy rain it would form a temporary shelter. What do you think of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: idea?" His friend had listened with half-closed eyes. He blew a whiff
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of cigarette smoke from his nostrils and answered:
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It is wonderful, De Plonville," he said drawlingly. "Its possibilities
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: are vast--more so than even you appear to think. It would be very
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: useful in our Alpine corps as well."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I am glad you think so. But why there?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Well, you see, if the army reached a high peak looking into a deep
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: valley, only to be reached over an inaccessible precipice, all the army
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: would have to do would be to spread out your superb invention and use
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it as a parachute. The sight of the army of France gradually floating
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: down into the valley would be so terrifying to the nations of Europe,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that I imagine no enemy would wait for a gun to be fired. De Plonville,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: your invention will immortalize you, and immortalize the French army."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Young De Plonville waited to hear no more, but turned on his heel and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: strode away.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: This conversation caused young De Plonville to make two resolutions;
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: first, to mention his scheme to no one; second, to persevere and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: perfect his invention, thus causing confusion to the scoffer. There
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: were several sub-resolutions dependent on these two. He would not enter
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: a club, he would abjure society, he would not speak to a woman--he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: would, in short, be a hermit until his invention stood revealed before
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: an astonished world.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: All of which goes to show that young De Plonville was not the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: conceited, meddlesome fop his acquaintances thought him. But in the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: large and small resolutions he did not deduct the ten per cent. for the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: unknown quantity.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Where? That was the question. De Plonville walked up and down his room,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and thought it out. A large map of France was spread on the table.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Paris and the environs thereof were manifestly impossible. He needed a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: place of seclusion. He needed a stretch of water. Where then should be
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the spot to which coming generations would point and say, "Here, at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: this place, was perfected De Plonville's celebrated parachute-tent-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bateau invention."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: No, not parachute. Hang the parachute! That was the scoffing
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: lieutenant's word. De Plonville paused for a moment to revile his folly
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in making a confidant of any army man.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: There was a sufficiency of water around the French coast, but it was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: too cold at that season of the year to experiment in the north and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: east. There was left the Mediterranean. He thought rapidly of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: different delightful spots along the Riviera--Cannes, St. Raphael,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Nice, Monte Carlo,--but all of these were too public and too much
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: thronged with visitors. The name of the place came to him suddenly,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and, as he stopped his march to and fro, De Plonville wondered why it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: had not suggested itself to him at the very first. Hyeres! It seemed to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: have been planned in the Middle Ages for the perfecting of just such an
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: invention. It was situated two or three miles back from the sea, the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: climate was perfect, there was no marine parade, the sea coast was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: lonely, and the bay sheltered by the islands. It was an ideal spot.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: De Plonville easily secured leave of absence. Sons of fathers high up
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in the service of a grateful country seldom have any difficulty about a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: little thing like that. He purchased a ticket for that leisurely train
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: which the French with their delicious sense of humor call the "Rapide,"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and in due time found himself with his various belongings standing on
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the station platform at Hyeres.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Few of us are as brave as we think ourselves. De Plonville flinched
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: when the supreme moment came, and perhaps that is why the Gods punished
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: him. He had resolved to go to one of the country inns at Carqueyranne
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: on the coast, but this was in a heroic mood when the lieutenant had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: laughed at his project. Now in a cooler moment he thought of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: cuisine of Carqueyranne and shuddered. There are sacrifices which no
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: man should be called upon to endure, so the naval officer hesitated,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and at last directed the porter to put his luggage on the top of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Costebelle Hotel "bus." There would be society at the hotel it is true,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: but he could avoid it, while if he went to the rural tavern he could
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: not avoid the cooking. Thus he smothered his conscience. Lunch at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: boiler plate, until his fingers' ends were sore. He stood up and waved
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his arms, but the first vessel fired again, and the ball came shrieking
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: over him so low that he intuitively ducked his head. Like a pang of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

text: they saw a man on the buoy, but as no man had any business there, the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: aim. The investigation which followed would be a feather in the cap of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the officer in charge, whatever the verdict. De Plonville, with
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Well, a man has to die but once, and there is little use in making a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fuss over the inevitable. He would meet his fate calmly and as a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Frenchman should, with his face to the guns. There was a tinge of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: regret that there would be no one to witness his heroism. It is always
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: reporter, present. It is best to be as comfortable as possible under
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: any circumstances, so De Plonville sat down on the spheroid and let his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: feet dangle toward the water. The great buoy for some reason floated
