author: Barr, Robert

text: around until it presented its side to the ships. None of the balls came
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: so near as those first fired--perhaps because of the accumulated smoke.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: New features of the situation continued to present themselves to De
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Plonville as he sat there. The firing had been going on for some time
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: before he reflected that if a shot punctured the buoy it would fill and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: sink. Perhaps their orders were to fire until the buoy disappeared.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: There was little comfort in this suggestion.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Firing had ceased for some minutes before he noticed the fact. A bank
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of thinning smoke rested on the water between the buoy and the ships.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: He saw the ironclads move ponderously around and steam through this
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bank turning broadside on again in one, two, three, order. He watched
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the evolution with his chin resting on his hands, not realizing that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the moment for signalling had come. When the idea penetrated his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: somewhat dazed mind, he sprang to his feet, but his opportunity had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: gone. The smoke of the first gun rose in the air, there was a clang of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: iron on iron, and De Plonville found himself whirling in space: then
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: sinking in the sea. Coming breathless to the surface, he saw the buoy
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: revolving slowly, and a deep dinge in its side seemed to slide over its
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: top and disappear into the water, showing where the shot had struck.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The second boat did not fire, and he knew that they were examining the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: buoy with their glasses. He swam around to the other side, intending to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: catch a ring and have it haul him up where he could be seen. Before he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: reached the place the buoy was at rest again, and as he laboriously
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: climbed on top more dead than alive, the second ship opened fire. He
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: lay down at full length exhausted, and hoped if they were going to hit
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: they would hit quick. Life was not worth having on these conditions. He
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: felt the hot sun on his back, and listened dreamily to the cannon. Hope
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was gone, and he wondered at himself for feeling a remote rather than
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: an active interest in his fate. He thought of himself as somebody else,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and felt a vague impersonal pity. He criticised the random firing, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: suspected the hit was merely a fluke. When his back was dry he rolled
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: lazily over and lay gazing up at the cloudless sky. For greater comfort
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he placed his hands beneath his head. The sky faded, and a moment's
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: unconsciousness intervened.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "This won't do," he cried, shaking himself. "If I fall asleep I shall
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: roll off."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: He sat up again, his joints stiff with his immersion, and watched the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: distant ironclads. He saw with languid interest a ball strike the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: water, take a new flight, and plunge into the sea far to the right. He
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: thought that the vagaries of cannon-balls at sea would make an
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: interesting study.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Are you injured?" cried a clear voice behind him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "_Mon Dieu!_" shouted the young man in a genuine fright, as he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: sprang to his feet.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, I beg pardon," as if a rescuer need apologize, "I thought you were
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: M. De Plonville."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I _am_ De Plonville."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Your hair is grey," she said in an awed whisper; then added, "and no
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: wonder."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Mademoiselle," replied the stricken young man, placing his hand on his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: heart, "it is needless to deny--I do not deny--that I was frightened--
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: but--I did not think--not so much as that, I regret. It is so--so--
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: theatrical--I am deeply sorrowful."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Please say no more, but come quickly. Can you come down? Step exactly
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in the middle of the canoe. Be careful--it is easily upset--and sit
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: down at once. That was very nicely done."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Mademoiselle, allow me at least to row the boat."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It is paddling, and you do not understand it. I do. Please do not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: speak until we are out of range. I am horribly frightened."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You are very, very brave."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Hs--s--sh."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Miss Stansby wielded the double-bladed paddle in a way a Red Indian
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: might have envied. Once she uttered a little feminine shriek as a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: cannon ball plunged into the water behind them; but as they got further
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: away from the buoy those on the iron-clads appeared to notice that a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: boat was within range, and the firing ceased.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Miss Stansby looked fixedly at the solemn young man sitting before her;
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: then placed her paddle across the canoe, bent over it, and laughed. De
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Plonville saw the reaction had come. He said sympathetically:--
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Ah, Mademoiselle, do not, I beg. All danger is over, I think."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I am not frightened, don't think it," she cried, flashing a look of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: defiance at him, and forgetting her admission of fear a moment before.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "My father was an Admiral. I am laughing at my mistake. It is salt."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What is?" asked her astonished passenger.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "In your hair."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: He ran his fingers through his hair, and the salt rattled down to the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bottom of the canoe. There was something of relief in _his_ laugh.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: De Plonville always believes the officers on board the gunboats
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: recognized him. When it was known in Paris that he was to be married to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the daughter of an English Admiral, whom rumor said he had bravely
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: saved from imminent peril, the army lieutenant remarked that she could
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: never have heard him speak her language--which, as we know, is not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: true.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: A NEW EXPLOSIVE.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The French Minister of War sat in his very comfortable chair in his own
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: private yet official room, and pondered over a letter he had received.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Being Minister of War, he was naturally the most mild, the most humane,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and least quarrelsome man in the Cabinet. A Minister of War receives
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: many letters that, as a matter of course, he throws into his waste
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: basket, but this particular communication had somehow managed to rivet
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his attention. When a man becomes Minister of War he learns for the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: first time that apparently the great majority of mankind are engaged in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the manufacture or invention of rifles, gunpowders, and devices of all
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: kinds for the destruction of the rest of the world.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: That morning, the Minister of War had received a letter which announced
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to him that the writer of it had invented an explosive so terrible that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: all known destructive agencies paled before it. As a Frenchman, he made
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the first offer of his discovery to the French Government. It would
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: cost the Minister nothing, he said, to make a test which would
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: corroborate his amazing claims for the substance, and the moment that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: test was made, any intelligent man would recognize the fact that the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: country which possessed the secret of this destructive compound would
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: at once occupy an unassailable position in a contentious world.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The writer offered personally to convince the Minister of the truth of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his assertions, provided they could go to some remote spot where the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: results of the explosion would do no damage, and where they would be
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: safe from espionage. The writer went on very frankly to say that if the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Minister consulted with the agents of the police, they would at once
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: see in this invitation a trap for the probable assassination of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Minister. But the inventor claimed that the Minister's own good sense
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: should show him that his death was desired by none. He was but newly
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: appointed, and had not yet had time to make enemies. France was at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: peace with all the world, and this happened before the time of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Anarchist demonstrations in Paris. It was but right, the letter went
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: on, that the Minister should have some guarantee as to the _bona
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fides_ of the inventor. He therefore gave his name and address, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: said if the Minister made inquiries from the police, he would find
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: nothing stood in their books against him. He was a student, whose
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: attention, for years, had been given to the subject of explosives. To
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: further show that he was entirely unselfish in this matter, he added
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that he had no desire to enrich himself by his discovery. He had a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: private income quite sufficient for his needs, and he intended to give,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and not to sell, his secret to France. The only proviso he made was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that his name should be linked with this terrible compound, which he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: maintained would secure universal peace to the world, for, after its
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: qualities were known, no nation would dare to fight with another. The
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: sole ambition of the inventor, said the letter in conclusion, was to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: place his name high in the list of celebrated French scientists. If,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: however, the Minister refused to treat with him he would go to other
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Governments until his invention was taken up, but the Government which
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: secured it would at once occupy the leading position among nations. He
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: entreated the Minister, therefore, for the sake of his country, to make
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: at least one test of the compound.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It was, as I have said, before the time of the Paris explosions, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ministers were not so suspicious then as they are now. The Minister
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: made inquiries regarding the scientist, who lived in a little suburb of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Paris, and found that there was nothing against him on the books of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: police. Inquiry showed that all he had said about his own private
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fortune was true. The Minister therefore wrote to the inventor, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: named an hour at which he would receive him in his private office.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The hour and the man arrived together. The Minister had had some slight
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: doubts regarding his sanity, but the letter had been so
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: straightforwardly written, and the appearance of the man himself was so
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: kindly and benevolent and intelligent that the doubts of the official
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: vanished.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I beg you to be seated," said the Minister. "We are entirely alone,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and nothing you say will be heard by any one but myself."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I thank you, Monsieur le Ministre," replied the inventor, "for this
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: mark of confidence; for I am afraid the claims I made in the letter
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: were so extraordinary that you might well have hesitated about granting
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: me an interview."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Minister smiled. "I understand," he said, "the enthusiasm of an
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: inventor for his latest triumph, and I was enabled thus to take, as it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: were, some discount from your statements, although I doubt not that you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: have discovered something that may be of benefit to the War
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Department."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The inventor hesitated, looking seriously at the great official before
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "From what you say," he began at last, "I am rather afraid that my
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: letter misled you, for, fearing it would not be credited I was obliged
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to make my claims so mild that I erred in under-estimating rather than
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in over-stating them. I have the explosive here in my pocket."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Ah!" cried the Minister, a shade of pallor coming over his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: countenance, as he pushed back his chair. "I thought I stated in my
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: note that you were not to bring it."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Forgive me for not obeying. It is perfectly harmless while in this
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: state. This is one of the peculiarities--a beneficent peculiarity if I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: may so term it--of this terrible agent. It may be handled with perfect
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: safety, and yet its effects are as inevitable as death," saying which,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he took out of his pocket and held up to the light a bottle filled with
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: a clear colorless liquid like water.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You could pour that on the fire," he said, "with no other effect than
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to put out the blaze. You might place it under a steam hammer and crush
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the bottle to powder, yet no explosion would follow. It is as harmless
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: as water in its present condition."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "How, then," said the Minister, "do you deal with it?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Again the man hesitated.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I am almost afraid to tell you," he said; "and if I could not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: demonstrate to your entire satisfaction that what I say is true, it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: would be folly for me to say what I am about to say. If I were to take
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: this bottle and cut a notch in the cork, and walk with it neck
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: downwards along the Boulevard des Italiens, allowing this fluid to fall
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: drop by drop on the pavement, I could walk in that way in safety
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: through every street in Paris. If it rained that day nothing would
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: happen. If it rained the next or for a week nothing would happen, but
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the moment the sun came out and dried the moisture, the light step of a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: cat on any pavement over which I had passed would instantly shatter to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ruins the whole of Paris."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Impossible!" cried the Minister, an expression of horror coming into
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his face.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I knew you would say that. Therefore I ask you to come with me to the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: country, where I can prove the truth of what I allege. While I carry
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: this bottle around with me in this apparently careless fashion, it is
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: corked, as you see with the utmost security. Not a drop of the fluid
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: must be left on the outside of the cork or of the bottle. I have wiped
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the bottle and cork most thoroughly, and burned the cloth which I used
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in doing so. Fire will not cause this compound, even when dry, to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: explode, but the slightest touch will set it off. I have to be
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: extremely careful in its manufacture, so that not a single drop is left
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: unaccounted for in any place where it might evaporate."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Minister, with his finger-tips together and his eyes on the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ceiling, mused for a few moments on the amazing statement he had heard.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "If what you say is true," he began at last, "don't you think it would
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: be more humane to destroy all traces of the experiments by which you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: discovered this substance, and to divulge the secret to no one? The
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: devastation such a thing would cause, if it fell into unscrupulous
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: hands, is too appalling even to contemplate."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I have thought of that," said the inventor; "but some one else--the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: time may be far off or it may be near--is bound to make the discovery.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: My whole ambition, as I told you in my letter, is to have my name
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: coupled with this discovery. I wish it to be known as the Lambelle
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Explosive. The secret would be safe with the French Government."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I am not so sure of that," returned the Minister. "Some unscrupulous
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: man may become Minister of War, and may use his knowledge to put
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: himself in the position of Dictator. An unscrupulous man in the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: possession of such a secret would be invincible."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What you say," replied the inventor, "is undoubtedly true; yet I am
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: determined that the name of Lambelle shall go down in history coupled
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: with the most destructive agent the world has ever known, or will know.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: If the Government of France will build for me a large stone structure
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: as secure as a fortress, I will keep my secret, but will fill that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: building with bottles like this, and then----"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I do not see," said the Minister, "that that would lessen the danger,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: if the unscrupulous man I speak of once became possessed of the keys;
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and, besides, the mere fact that such a secret existed would put other
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: inventors upon the track, and some one else less benevolent than
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: yourself would undoubtedly make the discovery. You admitted a moment
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ago that the chances were a future investigator would succeed in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: possession such a fearful explosive! No Government has ever yet been
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: successful in keeping the secret of either a gun or a gunpowder."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "There is, of course," said Lambelle, "much in what you say; but,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: inventor of gunpowder, for gunpowder in its day was as wonderful as
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: this is now."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Suddenly the Minister laughed aloud.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

text: THE GREAT PEGRAM MYSTERY.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: friend the late Sherlock Holmes_.)
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I dropped in on my friend, Sherlaw Kombs, to hear what he had to say
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: about the Pegram mystery, as it had come to be called in the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: newspapers. I found him playing the violin with a look of sweet peace
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and serenity on his face, which I never noticed on the countenances of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: those within hearing distance. I knew this expression of seraphic calm
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: indicated that Kombs had been deeply annoyed about something. Such,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: indeed, proved to be the case, for one of the morning papers had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: contained an article, eulogizing the alertness and general competence
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of Scotland Yard. So great was Sherlaw Kombs's contempt for Scotland
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Yard that he never would visit Scotland during his vacations, nor would
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he ever admit that a Scotchman was fit for anything but export.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: He generously put away his violin, for he had a sincere liking for me,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and greeted me with his usual kindness.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I have come," I began, plunging at once into the matter on my mind,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "to hear what you think of the great Pegram mystery."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I haven't heard of it," he said quietly, just as if all London were
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: not talking of that very thing. Kombs was curiously ignorant on some
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: subjects, and abnormally learned on others. I found, for instance, that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: political discussion with him was impossible, because he did not know
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: who Salisbury and Gladstone were. This made his friendship a great
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: boon.

author: Barr, Robert

text: "The Pegram mystery has baffled even Gregory, of Scotland Yard."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: We were now flying over Northern London, and the great detective leaned
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: back with every sign of _ennui_, closing his eyes. At last he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: spoke wearily:
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It is really too elementary, Whatson, but I am always willing to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: oblige a friend. I shall be relieved, however, when you are able to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: work out the A B C of detection for yourself, although I shall never
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: object to helping you with the words of more than three syllables.

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: do it before he reached Brewster, because tickets are again examined at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that point. When the train began to stop at the signal near Pegram, he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: came to the false conclusion that it was stopping at Brewster. The fact
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that the shot was not heard is accounted for by the screech of the air-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: brake, added to the noise of the train. Probably the whistle was also
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: sounding at the same moment. The train being a fast express would stop
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: as near the signal as possible. The air-brake will stop a train in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: twice its own length. Call it three times in this case. Very well. At
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: three times the length of this train from the signalpost towards
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: London, deducting half the length of the train, as this carriage is in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the middle, you will find the pistol."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Wonderful!" I exclaimed.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Commonplace," he murmured.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: At this moment the whistle sounded shrilly, and we felt the grind of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the air-brakes.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: enthusiasm. "This is indeed luck. We will get out here, Whatson, and

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: As the train stopped, we got out on the right-hand side of the line.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to green as I looked at it. As the train moved on with increasing
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert
