title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: western sky throwing a weird half-light on the shining metals. The rear
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: lamps of the train disappeared around a curve, and the signal stood at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: baleful red again. The black magic of the lonesome night in that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: strange place impressed me, but the detective was a most practical man.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: He placed his back against the signal-post, and paced up the line with
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: even strides, counting his steps. I walked along the permanent way
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: beside him silently. At last he stopped, and took a tapeline from his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: pocket. He ran it out until the ten feet six inches were unrolled,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: scanning the figures in the wan light of the new moon. Giving me the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: end, he placed his knuckles on the metals, motioning me to proceed down
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the embankment. I stretched out the line, and then sank my hand in the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: damp grass to mark the spot.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Good God!" I cried, aghast, "what is this?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It is the pistol," said Kombs quietly.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It was!!
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Journalistic London will not soon forget the sensation that was caused
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: by the record of the investigations of Sherlaw Kombs, as printed at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: length in the next day's _Evening Blade_. Would that my story
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ended here. Alas! Kombs contemptuously turned over the pistol to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Scotland Yard. The meddlesome officials, actuated, as I always hold, by
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: jealousy, found the name of the seller upon it. They investigated. The
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: seller testified that it had never been in the possession of Mr.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Kipson, as far as he knew. It was sold to a man whose description
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: tallied with that of a criminal long watched by the police. He was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: arrested, and turned Queen's evidence in the hope of hanging his pal.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It seemed that Mr. Kipson, who was a gloomy, taciturn man, and usually
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: came home in a compartment by himself, thus escaping observation, had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: been murdered in the lane leading to his house. After robbing him, the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: miscreants turned their thoughts towards the disposal of the body--a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: subject that always occupies a first-class criminal mind before the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: deed is done. They agreed to place it on the line, and have it mangled
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: by the Scotch Express, then nearly due. Before they got the body half-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: way up the embankment the express came along and stopped. The guard got
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: out and walked along the other side to speak with the engineer. The
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: thought of putting the body into an empty first-class carriage
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: instantly occurred to the murderers. They opened the door with the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: deceased's key. It is supposed that the pistol dropped when they were
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: hoisting the body in the carriage.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Queen's evidence dodge didn't work, and Scotland Yard ignobly
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: insulted my friend Sherlaw Kombs by sending him a pass to see the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: villains hanged.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: DEATH COMETH SOON OR LATE.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It was Alick Robbins who named the invalid the Living Skeleton, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: probably remorse for having thus given him a title so descriptively
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: accurate, caused him to make friends with the Living Skeleton, a man
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: who seemed to have no friends.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Robbins never forgot their first conversation. It happened in this way.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It was the habit of the Living Skeleton to leave his hotel every
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: morning promptly at ten o'clock, if the sun was shining, and to shuffle
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: rather than walk down the gravel street to the avenue of palms. There,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: picking out a seat on which the sun shone, the Living Skeleton would
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: sit down and seem to wait patiently for someone who never came. He wore
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: a shawl around his neck and a soft cloth cap on his skull. Every bone
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in his face stood out against the skin, for there seemed to be no
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: flesh, and his clothes hung as loosely upon him as they would have upon
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: a skeleton. It required no second glance at the Living Skeleton to know
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that the remainder of his life was numbered by days or hours, and not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: by weeks or months. He didn't seem to have energy enough even to read,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and so it was that Robbins sat down one day on the bench beside him,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and said sympathetically:--
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I hope you are feeling better to-day."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Skeleton turned towards him, laughed a low, noiseless, mirthless
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: laugh for a moment, and then said, in a hollow, far-away voice that had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: no lungs behind it: "I am done with feeling either better or worse."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, I trust it is not so bad as that," said Robbins; "the climate is
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: doing you good down here, is it not?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Again the Skeleton laughed silently, and Robbins began to feel uneasy.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Skeleton's eyes were large and bright, and they fastened themselves
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: upon Robbins in a way that increased that gentleman's uneasiness, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: made him think that perhaps the Skeleton knew he had so named him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I have no more interest in climate," said the Skeleton. "I merely seem
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to live because I have been in the habit of living for some years; I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: presume that is it, because my lungs are entirely gone. Why I can talk
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: or why I can breathe is a mystery to me. You are perfectly certain you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: can hear me?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, I hear you quite distinctly," said Robbins.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Well, if it wasn't that people tell me that they can hear me, I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: wouldn't believe I was really speaking, because, you see, I have
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: nothing to speak with. Isn't it Shakespeare who says something about
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: when the brains are out the man is dead? Well, I have seen some men who
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: make me think Shakespeare was wrong in his diagnosis, but it is
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: generally supposed that when the lungs are gone a man is dead. To tell
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the truth, I _am_ dead, practically. You know the old American
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: story about the man who walked around to save funeral expenses; well,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it isn't quite that way with me, but I can appreciate how the man felt.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Still I take a keen interest in life, although you might not think so.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: You see, I haven't much time left; I am going to die at eight o'clock
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: on the 30th of April. Eight o'clock at night, not in the morning, just
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: after _table d'hote_."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You are going to _what_!" cried Robbins in astonishment.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I'm going to die that day. You see I have got things to such a fine
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: point, that I can die any time I want to. I could die right here, now,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: if I wished. If you have any mortal interest in the matter I'll do it,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and show you what I say is true. I don't mind much, you know, although
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I had fixed April the 30th as the limit. It wouldn't matter a bit for
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: me to go off now, if it would be of any interest to you."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I beg you," said Robbins, very much alarmed, "not to try any
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: experiments on my account. I am quite willing to believe anything you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: say about the matter--of course you ought to know."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Yes, I do know." answered the Living Skeleton sadly. "Of course I have
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: had my struggle with hope and fear, but that is all past now, as you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: may well understand. The reason that I have fixed the date for April
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: 30th is this: you see I have only a certain amount of money--I do not
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: know why I should make any secret of it. I have exactly 240 francs
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: today, over and above another 100 francs which I have set aside for
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: another purpose. I am paying 8 francs a day at the Golden Dragon; that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: will keep me just thirty days, and then I intend to die."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Skeleton laughed again, without sound, and Robbins moved uneasily
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: on the seat.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I don't see," he said finally, "what there is to laugh about in that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: condition of affairs."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I don't suppose there is very much; but there is something else that I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: consider very laughable, and that I will tell you if you will keep it a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: secret. You see, the Golden Dragon himself--I always call our innkeeper
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the Golden Dragon, just as you call me, the Living Skeleton."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, I--I--beg your pardon," stammered Robbins, "I----."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It really doesn't matter at all. You are perfectly right, and I think
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it a very apt term. Well, the old Golden Dragon makes a great deal of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his money by robbing the dead. You didn't know that, did you? You
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: thought it was the living who supported him, and goodness knows he robs
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: _them_ when he has a chance. Well, you are very much mistaken.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: When a man dies in the Golden Dragon, he, or his friends rather, have
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to pay very sweetly for it. The Dragon charges them for re-furnishing
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the room. Every stick of furniture is charged for, all the wall-paper,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and so on. I suppose it is perfectly right to charge something, but the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Dragon is not content with what is right. He knows he has finally lost
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: a customer, and so he makes all he can out of him. The furniture so
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: paid for, is not re-placed, and the walls are not papered again, but
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the Dragon doesn't abate a penny of his bill on that account. Now, I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: have inquired of the furnishing man, on the street back of the hotel,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and he has written on his card just the cost of mattress, sheets,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: pillows, and all that sort of thing, and the amount comes to about 50
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: francs. I have put in an envelope a 50-franc note, and with it the card
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of the furniture man. I have written a letter to the hotel-keeper,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: telling him just what the things will cost that he needs, and have
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: referred the Dragon to the card of the furniture man who has given me
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the figures. This envelope I have addressed to the Dragon, and he will
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: find it when I am dead. This is the joke that old man Death and myself
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: have put up on our host, and my only regret is that I shall not be able
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to enjoy a look at the Dragon's countenance as he reads my last letter
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to him. Another sum of money I have put away, in good hands where he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: won't have a chance to get it, for my funeral expenses, and then you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: see I am through with the world. I have nobody to leave that I need
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: worry about, or who would either take care of me or feel sorry for me
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: if I needed care or sympathy, which I do not. So that is why I laugh,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and that is why I come down and sit upon this bench, in the sunshine,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and enjoy the posthumous joke."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Robbins did not appear to see the humor of the situation quite as
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: strongly as the Living Skeleton did. At different times after, when
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: they met he had offered the Skeleton more money if he wanted it, so
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that he might prolong his life a little, but the Skeleton always
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: refused.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: A sort of friendship sprang up between Robbins and the Living Skeleton,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: at least, as much of a friendship as can exist between the living and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the dead, for Robbins was a muscular young fellow who did not need to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: live at the Riviera on account of his health, but merely because he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: detested an English winter. Besides this, it may be added, although it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: really is nobody's business, that a Nice Girl and her parents lived in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: this particular part of the South of France.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: One day Robbins took a little excursion in a carriage to Toulon. He had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: invited the Nice Girl to go with him, but on that particular day she
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: could not go. There was some big charity function on hand, and one
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: necessary part of the affair was the wheedling of money out of people's
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: pockets, so the Nice Girl had undertaken to do part of the wheedling.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: She was very good at it, and she rather prided herself upon it, but
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: then she was a very nice girl, pretty as well, and so people found it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: difficult to refuse her. On the evening of the day there was to be a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ball at the principal hotel of the place, also in connection with this
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: very desirable charity. Robbins had reluctantly gone to Toulon alone,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: but you may depend upon it he was back in time for the ball.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Well," he said to the Nice Girl when he met her, "what luck
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: collecting, to-day?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, the greatest luck," she replied enthusiastically, "and whom do you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: think I got the most money from?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I am sure I haven't the slightest idea--that old English Duke, he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: certainly has money enough."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "No, not from him at all; the very last person you would expect it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: from--your friend, the Living Skeleton."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What!" cried Robbins, in alarm.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, I found him on the bench where he usually sits, in the avenue of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the palms. I told him all about the charity and how useful it was, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: how necessary, and how we all ought to give as much as we could towards
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it, and he smiled and smiled at me in that curious way of his. 'Yes,'
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he said in a whisper, 'I believe the charity should be supported by
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: everyone; I will give you eighty francs.' Now, wasn't that very
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: generous of him? Eighty francs, that was ten times what the Duke gave,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and as he handed me the money he looked up at me and said in that awful
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: whisper of his: 'Count this over carefully when you get home and see if
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you can find out what else I have given you. There is more than eighty
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: francs there.' Then, after I got home, I----"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: But here the Nice Girl paused, when she looked at the face of Robbins,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to whom she was talking. That face was ghastly pale and his eyes were
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: staring at her but not seeing her.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Eighty francs," he was whispering to himself, and he seemed to be
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: making a mental calculation. Then noticing the Nice Girl's amazed look
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: at him, he said:
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Did you take the money?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Of course I took it," she said, "why shouldn't I?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Great Heavens!" gasped Robbins, and without a word he turned and fled,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: leaving the Nice Girl transfixed with astonishment and staring after
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: him with a frown on her pretty brow.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What does he mean by such conduct?" she asked herself. But Robbins
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: disappeared from the gathering throng in the large room of the hotel,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: dashed down the steps, and hurried along the narrow pavements toward
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the "Golden Dragon." The proprietor was standing in the hallway with
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his hands behind him, a usual attitude with the Dragon.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Where," gasped Robbins, "is Mr.--Mr.----" and then he remembered he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: didn't know the name. "Where is the Living Skeleton?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "He has gone to his room," answered the Dragon, "he went early to-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: night, he wasn't feeling well, I think."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What is the number of his room?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "No. 40," and the proprietor rang a loud, jangling bell, whereupon one
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of the chambermaids appeared. "Show this gentleman to No. 40."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The girl preceded Robbins up the stairs. Once she looked over her
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: shoulder, and said in a whisper, "Is he worse?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I don't know," answered Robbins, "that's what I have come to see."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: At No. 40 the girl paused, and rapped lightly on the door panel. There
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was no response. She rapped again, this time louder. There was still no
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: response.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Try the door," said Robbins.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I am afraid to," said the girl.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Why?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Because he said if he were asleep the door would be locked, and if he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: were dead the door would be open."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "When did he say that?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "He said it several times, sir; about a week ago the last time."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Robbins turned the handle of the door; it was not locked. A dim light
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was in the room, but a screen before the door hid it from sight. When
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he passed round the screen he saw, upon the square marble-topped
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: arrangement at the head of the bed, a candle burning, and its light
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: shone on the dead face of the Skeleton, which had a grim smile on its
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: thin lips, while in its clenched hand was a letter addressed to the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: proprietor of the hotel.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The Living Skeleton had given more than the eighty francs to that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: deserving charity.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: HIGH STAKES.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The snow was gently sifting down through the white glare of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: electric light when Pony Rowell buttoned his overcoat around him and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: left the Metropolitan Hotel, which was his home. He was a young man,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: not more than thirty, and his face was a striking one. It was clean cut
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and clean shaven. It might have been the face of an actor or the face
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of a statesman. An actor's face has a certain mobility of expression
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: resulting from the habit of assuming characters differing widely.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Rowell's face, when you came to look at it closely, showed that it had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: been accustomed to repress expression rather than to show emotion of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: any kind. A casual look at Pony Rowell made you think his face would
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: tell you something; a closer scrutiny showed you that it would tell you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: nothing. His eyes were of a piercing steely gray that seemed to read
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the thoughts of others, while they effectually concealed his own. Pony
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Rowell was known as a man who never went back on his word. He was a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: professional gambler.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: On this particular evening he strolled up the avenue with the easy
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: carriage of a man of infinite leisure. He hesitated for a moment at an
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: illy-lighted passage-way in the middle of a large building on a side
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: street, then went in and mounted a stair. He rapped lightly at a door.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: A slide was shoved back and a man inside peered out at him for a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: moment. Instantly the door was opened, for Pony's face was good for
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: admittance at any of the gambling rooms in the city. There was still
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: another guarded door to pass, for an honest gambling-house keeper can
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: never tell what streak of sudden morality may strike the police, and it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: is well to have a few moments' time in which to conceal the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: paraphernalia of the business. Of course, Mellish's gambling rooms were
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: as well known to the police as to Pony Rowell, but unless some fuss was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: made by the public, Mellish knew he would be free from molestation.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Mellish was a careful man, and a visitor had to be well vouched for,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: before he gained admission. There never was any trouble in Mellish's
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: rooms. He was often known to advise a player to quit when he knew the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: young gambler could not afford to lose, and instances were cited where
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he had been the banker of some man in despair. Everybody liked Mellish,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: for his generosity was unbounded, and he told a good story well.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Inside the room that Pony Rowell had penetrated, a roulette table was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: at its whirling work and faro was going on in another spot. At small
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: tables various visitors were enjoying the game of poker.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Hello, Pony," cried Bert Ragstock, "are you going to give me my
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: revenge to-night?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I'm always willing to give anyone his revenge." answered Pony
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: imperturbably, lighting a fresh cigarette.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "All right then; come and sit down here."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I'm not going to play just yet. I want to look on for a while."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Nonsense. I've been waiting for you ever so long already. Sit down."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You ought to know by this time, Bert, that when I say a thing I mean
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it. I won't touch a card till the clock begins to strike 12. Then I'm
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: wid ye."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Pshaw, Pony, you ought to be above that sort of thing. That's
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: superstition, Rowell. You're too cool a man to mind when you touch a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: card. Come on."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "That's all right. At midnight, I said to myself, and at midnight it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: shall be or not at all."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The old gamblers in the place nodded approval of this resolution. It
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was all right enough for Bert Ragstock to sneer at superstition,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: because he was not a real gambler. He merely came to Mellish's rooms in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the evening because the Stock Exchange did not keep open all night.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Strange to say Ragstock was a good business man as well as a cool
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: gambler. He bemoaned the fate that made him so rich that gambling had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: not the exhilarating effect on him which it would have had if he had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: been playing in desperation.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: When the clock began to chime midnight Pony Rowell took up the pack and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: began to shuffle.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Now, old man," he said, "I'm going in to win. I'm after big game to-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: night."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Right you are." cried Bert, with enthusiasm. "I'll stand by you as
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: long as the spots stay on the cards."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: In the gray morning, when most of the others had left and even Mellish
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: himself was yawning, they were still at it. The professional gambler
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: had won a large sum of money; the largest sum he ever possessed. Yet
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: there was no gleam of triumph in his keen eyes. Bert might have been
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: winning for all the emotion his face showed. They were a well matched
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: pair, and they enjoyed playing with each other.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "There," cried Pony at last, "haven't you had enough? Luck's against
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you. I wouldn't run my head any longer against a brick wall, if I were
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "My dear Pony, how often have I told you there is no such thing as
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: luck. But to tell the truth I'm tired and I'm going home. The revenge
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: is postponed. When do I meet the enemy again?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Pony Rowell shuffled the cards idly for a few moments without replying
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: or raising his eyes. At last he said:
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "The next time I play you, Bert, it will be for high stakes."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Good heavens, aren't you satisfied with the stakes we played for to-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: night?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "No. I want to play you for a stake that will make even your hair stand
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: on end. Will you do it?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Certainly. When?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "That I can't tell just yet. I have a big scheme on hand. I am to see a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: man to-day about it. All I want to know is that you promise to play."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Pony, this is mysterious. I guess you're not afraid I will flunk out.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I'm ready to meet you on any terms and for any stake."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Enough said. I'll let you know some of the particulars as soon as I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: find out all I want myself. Good-night."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Good-night to you, rather," said Bert, as Mellish helped him on with
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his overcoat. "You've won the pile: robbing a poor man of his hard-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: earned gains!"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, the poor man does not need the money as badly as I do. Besides,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I'm going to give you a chance to win it all back again and more."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: When Ragstock had left, Pony still sat by the table absent-mindedly
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: shuffling the cards.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "If I were you," said Mellish, laying his hand on his shoulder, "I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: would put that pile in the bank and quit."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "The faro bank?" asked Pony, looking up with a smile.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "No, I'd quit the business altogether if I were you. I'm going to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: myself."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, we all know that. You've been going to quit for the last twenty
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: years. Well, I'm going to quit, too, but not just yet. That's what they
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: all say, of course, but I mean it."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: In the early and crisp winter air Pony Rowell walked to the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Metropolitan Hotel and to bed. At 3 that afternoon the man he had an
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: appointment with, called to see him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You wanted to see me about an Insurance policy," the visitor began. An
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: agent is always ready to talk of business. "Now, were you thinking of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: an endowment scheme or have you looked into our new bond system of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: insurance? The twenty-pay-life style of thing seems to be very
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: popular."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I want to ask you a few questions," said Pony. "If I were to insure my
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: life in your company and were to commit suicide would that invalidate
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the policy?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Not after two years. After two years, in our company, the policy is
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: incontestable."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Two years? That won't do for me. Can't you make it one year?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I'll tell you what I will do," said the agent, lowering his voice, "I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: can ante-date the policy, so that the two years will end just when you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: like, say a year from now."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Very well. If you can legally fix it so that the two years come to an
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: end about this date next year I will insure in your company for
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The agent opened his eyes when the amount was mentioned.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I don't want endowments or bonds, but the cheapest form of life
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: insurance you have, and----"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Straight life is what you want."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Straight life it is, then, and I will pay you for the two years or
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: say, to make it sure, for two years and a half down, when you bring me
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the papers."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Thus it was that with part of the money he had won, Pony Rowell insured
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his life for $100,000, and with another part he paid his board and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: lodging for a year ahead at the Metropolitan Hotel.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The remainder he kept to speculate on.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: During the year that followed he steadily refused to play with Bert
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Ragstock, and once or twice they nearly had a quarrel about it--that is
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: as near as Pony could come to having a row with anybody, for
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: quarrelling was not in his line. If he had lived in a less civilized
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: part of the community Pony might have shot, but as it was quarrels
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: never came to anything, therefore he did not indulge in any.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "A year from the date of our last game? What nonsense it is waiting all
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that time. You play with others, why not with me? Think of the chances
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: we are losing," complained Bert.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "We will have a game then that will make up for all the waiting,"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: answered Rowell.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: At last the anniversary came and when the hour struck that ushered it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in Pony Rowell and Bert Ragstock sat facing each other, prepared to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: resume business on the old stand.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Ah," said Bert, rubbing his hands, "it feels good to get opposite you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: once more. Pony, you're a crank. We might have had a hundred games like
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: this during the past year, if there wasn't so much superstition about
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Not quite like this. This is to be the last game I play, win or lose.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I tell you that now, so that there won't be any talk of revenge if I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: win."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You don't mean it! I've heard talk like that before."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "All right. I've warned you. Now I propose that this be a game of pure
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: luck. We get a new pack of cards, shuffle them, cut, then you pull one
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: card and I another. Ace high. The highest takes the pot. Best two out
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of three. Do you agree?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Of course. How much is the pile to be?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "One hundred thousand dollars."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, you're dreaming."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Isn't it enough?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Thunder! You never _saw_ $100,000."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You will get the money if I lose."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Say, Pony, that's coming it a little strong. One hundred thousand
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: dollars! Heavens and earth! How many business men in this whole city
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: would expect their bare word to be taken for $100,000?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I'm not a business man. I'm a gambler."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "True, true. Is the money in sight?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "No; but you'll be paid. Your money is not in sight. I trust you. Can't
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you trust me?
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It isn't quite the same thing, Pony. I'll trust you for three times
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the money you have in sight, but when you talk about $100,000 you are
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: talking of a lot of cash."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "If I can convince Mellish here that you will get your money, will you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: play?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You can convince me just as easily as you can Mellish. What's the use
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of dragging him in?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I could convince you in a minute, but you might still refuse to play.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Now I'm bound to play this game and I can't take any risks. If my word
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and Mellish's isn't good enough for you, why, say so."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "All right," cried Bert. "If you can convince Mellish that you will pay
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: if you lose I'll play you."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Rowell and Mellish retired into an inner room and after a few minutes
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: reappeared again.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Mellish's face was red when he went in. He was now a trifle pale.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I don't like this, Bert," Mellish said, "and I think this game had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: better stop right here."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Then you are not convinced that I am sure of my money?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Yes, I am, but----"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "That's enough for me. Get out your new pack."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You've given your word, Mellish," said Pony, seeing the keeper of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: house was about to speak. "Don't say any more."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "For such a sum two out of three is too sudden. Make it five out of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: nine," put in Bert.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I'm willing."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The new pack of cards was brought and the wrappings torn off.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You shuffle first; I'll cut," said Rowell. His lips seemed parched and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he moistened them now and then, which was unusual for so cool a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: gambler. Mellish fidgeted around with lowered brow. Bert shuffled the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: cards as nonchalantly as if he had merely a $5 bill on the result. When
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: each had taken a card, Bert held an ace and Pony a king. Pony shuffled
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and the turn up was a spot in Pony's hand and queen in that of his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: opponent. Bert smiled and drops began to show on Pony's forehead in

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Ah, madam, there is no need to do that. It would delay us, and time is
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: everything in a case like this. Besides, they will have ample warning
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: if she is going down and they will have time to get everybody in the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: boats. We will stand by them, you know."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, the poor creatures," cried the sympathetic Mrs. Second-Adjutant.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Think of their awful position. May be engulfed at any moment. I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: suppose they are all on their knees in the cabin. How thankful they
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: must have been to see the Adamant."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: On all sides there was the profoundest sympathy for the unfortunate
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: passengers of the Vulcan. Cheeks paled at the very thought of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: catastrophe that might take place at any moment within sight of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: sister ship. It was a realistic object lesson on the ever-present
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: steamship plunging along within a mile of them, the captain slipped
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: away to his room. As he sat there there was a tap at his door.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Come in," shouted the captain.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The silent Englishman slowly entered.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What's wrong, captain," he asked.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Yes, I know all that, of course, but what's wrong _with us_?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Yes, with the Adamant? What has been amiss for the last two or three
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: days? I'm not a talker, nor am I afraid any more than you are, but I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: want to know."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Certainly," said the captain. "Please shut the door, Sir John."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: member of Congress.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: hysterics. Children clung, with pale faces, to their mother's skirts,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fearing they knew not what. Men were grouped with anxious faces, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the bluff old captain fronted them all.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "The meaning of all _what_, sir?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You know very well. What is the meaning of our turning-round?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It means, sir, that the Adamant has eighty-five saloon passengers and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: nearly 500 intermediate and steerage passengers who are in the most
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: deadly danger. The cotton in the hold is on fire, and they have been
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fighting it night and day. A conflagration may break out at any moment.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It means, then, sir, that the Vulcan is going to stand by the Adamant."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: A wail of anguish burst from the frightened women at the awful fate
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that might be in store for so many human beings so near to them, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: they clung closer to their children and thanked God that no such danger
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: threatened them and those dear to them.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "And dammit, sir," cried the Congressman, "do you mean to tell us that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: we have to go against our will--without even being consulted--back to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Well, by the gods, that's an outrage, and I won't stand it, sir. I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

text: the company, sir."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Mr. Vincent," said the captain sternly, "permit me to remind you that
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

text: And so the two steamships, side by side, worried their way toward the
title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Why! _Mrs.--General_--WELLER!!! You don't mean to say you were on
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: board that unfortunate Vulcan!"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "For the land's sake, Mrs. Assistant Brownrig! Is that really
title: The Face and the Mask

text: _you_? Will wonders never cease? Unfortunate, did you say?
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to death?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: at any moment?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: moment? It was you that might have gone down at any moment or, worse

author: Barr, Robert

text: still, have been burnt to death if the fire had got ahead. You don't
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

text: across?"
title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: both of them.

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

text: of 'em."

text: Of course no one will believe me when I say that Mellish was in every
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: respect, except one, an exemplary citizen and a good-hearted man. He
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was generous to a fault and he gave many a young fellow a start in life
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: where a little money or a few encouraging words were needed. He drank,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of course, but he was a connoisseur in liquors, and a connoisseur never
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: goes in for excess. Few could tell a humorous story as well as Mellish,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and he seldom dealt in chestnuts. No man can be wholly bad who never
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: inflicts an old story on his friends, locating it on some acquaintance
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of his, and alleging that it occurred the day before.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: If I wished to write a heart-rending article on the evils of gambling,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Mellish would be the man I would go to for my facts and for the moral
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of the tale. He spent his life persuading people not to gamble. He
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: never gambled himself, he said. But if no attention was paid to his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: advice, why then he furnished gamblers with the most secluded and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: luxurious gambling rooms in the city. It was supposed that Mellish
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: stood in with the police, which was, of course, a libel. The idea of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the guardians of the city standing in with a gambler or a gambling
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: house! The statement was absurd on the face of it. If you asked any
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: policeman in the city where Mellish's gambling rooms were, you would
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: speedily learn that not one of them had ever even heard of the place.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: All this goes to show how scandalously people will talk, and if
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Mellish's rooms were free from raids, it was merely Mellish's good
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: luck, that was all. Anyhow, in Mellish's rooms you could have a quiet,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: gentlemanly game for stakes about as high as you cared to go, and you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: were reasonably sure there would be no fuss and that your name would
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: not appear in the papers next morning.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: One night as Mellish cast his eye around his well-filled main room he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: eye for strangers and in an unobtrusive way generally managed to find
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: out something about them. A stranger in a gambling room brings in with
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: as Sotty, an ex-prize fighter and a dangerous man to handle if it came
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to trouble. It rarely came to trouble there, but Sotty was, in a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: place in the heated atmosphere of that room, under the glare of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: gas. Mellish sighed as he looked at him, then he turned to Sotty and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: said:
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: throw even a sprat out of the net. Many a time he had known Mellish to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: face and followed Sotty. The thing was done quietly, and all those
title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: attention.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: all visitors here. You couldn't get in unless you came with someone

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

text: in the morning."

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert
