text: The air-brake was grinding the long train and sending a shiver of fear
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: through every timber, but the rails were slippery with frost, and the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: speed of the train seemed as great as ever. At the right moment Saggart
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: reversed the engine, and the sparks flew up from her great drivers like
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: catharine wheels.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Brace yourself," cried Saggart. "No. 6 is backing up, thank God!"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Next instant the crash came. Two headlights and two cow-catchers went
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to flinders, and the two trains stood there with horns locked, but no
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: great damage done, except a shaking up for a lot of panic-stricken
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: passengers.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The burly engineer of No. 6 jumped down and came forward, his mouth
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: full of oaths.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What the h--l do you mean by running in on our time like this? Hello,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: is that you, Saggart? I thought there was a new man on to-night. I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: didn't expect this from _you_."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It's all right, Billy. It wasn't the new man's fault. He's back in the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ditch with a broken leg, I should say, from the way he jumped. Old
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Eighty-six is to blame. She got on the rampage. Took advantage of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: greenhorn."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The conductor came running up.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "How is it?" he cried.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It's all right. Number Eighty-six got her nose broke, and served her
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: right, that's all. Tell the passengers there's no danger, and get 'em
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: on board. We're going to back up to Pointsville. Better send the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: brakesmen to pick up the other engineer. The ground's hard tonight, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he may be hurt."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I'm going back to talk to the president," said the conductor
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: emphatically. "He's in a condition of mind to listen to reason, judging
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: from the glimpse I got of his face at the door of his car a moment ago.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Either he re-instates you or I go gathering tickets on a street-car.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: This kind of thing is too exciting for my nerves."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The conductor's interview with the president of the road was apparently
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: satisfactory, for old Number Eighty-six is trying to lead a better life
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: under the guidance of John Saggart.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: PLAYING WITH MARKED CARDS.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I'm bothered about that young fellow," said Mellish early one morning,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to the professional gambler, Pony Rowell.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Why?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "He comes here night after night, and he loses more than he can afford,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I imagine. He has no income, so far as I can find out, except what he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: gets as salary, and it takes a mighty sight bigger salary than his to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: stand the strain he's putting on it."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What is his business?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "He is cashier in the Ninth National Bank. I don't know how much he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: gets, but it can't be enough to permit this sort of thing to go on."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Pony Rowell shrugged his shoulders.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I don't think I would let it trouble me, if I were you, Mellish."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Nevertheless it does. I have advised him to quit, but it is no use. If
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I tell the doorkeeper not to let him in here, he will merely go
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: somewhere else where they are not so particular."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I must confess I don't quite understand you, Mellish, long as I have
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: known you. In your place, now, I would either give up keeping a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: gambling saloon or I would give up the moral reformation line of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: business. I wouldn't try to ride two horses of such different tempers
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: at the same time."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I've never tried to reform you, Pony," said Mellish, with reproach in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his voice.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "No; I will give you credit for that much sense."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It's all right with old stagers like you and me, Pony, but with a boy
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: just beginning life, it is different. Now it struck me that you might
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: be able to help me in this."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Yes, I thought that was what you were leading up to," said Rowell,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: thrusting his hands deep in his trousers' pockets. "I'm no missionary,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: remember. What did you want me to do?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I wanted you to give him a sharp lesson. Couldn't you mark a pack of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: cards and get him to play high? Then, when you have taken all his ready
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: money and landed him in debt to you so that he can't move, give him
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: back his cash if he promises not to gamble again."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Rowell looked across at the subject of their conversation. "I don't
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: think I would flatter him so much as to even stock the cards on him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I'll clean him out if you like. But it won't do any good, Mellish. Look
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: at his eyes. The insanity of gambling is in them. I used to think if I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: had $100,000, I would quit. I'm old enough now to know that I wouldn't.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I'd gamble if I had a million."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I stopped after I was your age."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, yes, Mellish, you are the virtuous exception that proves the rule.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: You quit gambling the way the old woman kept tavern," and Rowell cast a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: glance over the busy room.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Mellish smiled somewhat grimly, then he sighed. "I wish I was out of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it," he said. "But, anyhow, you think over what I've been talking
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: about, and if you can see your way to giving him a sharp lesson I wish
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you would."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "All right I will, but merely to ease your tender conscience, Mellish.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It's no use, I tell you. When the snake has bitten, the victim is
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: doomed. Gambling isn't a simple thing like the opium habit."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Reggie Forme, the bank cashier, rose at last from the roulette table.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: He was flushed with success, for there was a considerable addition to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the sum he had in his pockets when he sat down. He flattered himself
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that the result was due to the system he had elaborately studied out.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Nothing lures a man to destruction quicker than a system that can be
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: mathematically demonstrated. It gives an air of business to gambling
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: which is soothing to the conscience of a person brought up on
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: statistics. The system generally works beautifully at first; then a cog
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: slips and you are mangled in the machinery before you know where you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: are. As young Forme left the table he felt a hand on his shoulder, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: looking around, met the impassive gaze of Pony Rowell.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You're young at the business, I see," remarked the professional
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: quietly.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Why do you think that?" asked the youngster, coloring, for one likes
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to be taken for a veteran, especially when one is an amateur.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Because you fool away your time at roulette. That is a game for boys
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and women. Have you nerve enough to play a real game?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What do you call a real game?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "A game with cards in a private room for something bigger than half-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: dollar points."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "How big?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Depends on what capital you have. How much capital can you command?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The cashier hesitated for a moment and his eyes fell from the steady
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: light of Rowell's, which seemed to have an uncomfortable habit of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: looking into one's inmost soul.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I can bring $1,000 here on Saturday night."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "All right. That will do as a starter. Is it an appointment then?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Yes, if you like. What time?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I generally get here pretty late, but I can make an exception in your
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: case. What do you say to 10 o'clock?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "That will suit me."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Very well, then. Don't fool away any of your money or nerve until I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: come. You will need all you have of both."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The professional gambler and the amateur began their series of games a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: few minutes after ten in a little private room. The young man became
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: more and more excited as the play went on. As for Pony, he was cool
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: under any circumstances. Before an hour had passed the $1,000 was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: transferred from the possession of Forme into the pockets of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: professional, and by midnight the younger man was another $1,000 in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Rowell's debt.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It isn't my practice," said Rowell slowly, "to play with a man unless
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he has the money in sight. I've made an exception in your case, as luck
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was against you, but I think this has gone far enough. You may bring me
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the $1,000 you owe any day next week. No particular hurry, you know."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The young fellow appeared to be dazed. He drew his hand across his brow
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and then said mechanically, as if he had just heard his opponent's
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: remark:
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "No hurry? All right. Next week. Certainly. I guess I'll go home now."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Forme went out, leaving Rowell idly shuffling the cards at the small
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: table. The moment the young man had disappeared all Rowell's indolence
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: vanished. He sprang up and put on his overcoat, then slipped out by the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: rear exit into the alley. He had made up his mind what Forme would do.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Mentally he tracked him from the gambling rooms to the river and he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: even went so far as to believe he would take certain streets on his way
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: thither. A gambler is nothing if not superstitious and so Rowell was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: not in the least surprised when he saw the young man emerge from the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: dark stairway, hesitate for a moment between the two directions open to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: him, and finally choose the one that the gambler expected him to take.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The cold streets were deserted and so Rowell had more difficulty in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: following his late victim unperceived than he would have had earlier in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the evening. Several times the older man thought the pursued had become
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: aware of the pursuit, for Forme stopped and looked around him; once
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: coming back and taking another street as if trying to double on the man
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: who was following him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Rowell began to realize the difficulty of the task he had set for
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: himself, and as he had never had any faith in it anyhow, he began to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: feel uncomfortable and to curse the tender heart of Mellish. If the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: youngster got the idea into his head that he was followed he might
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: succeed in giving his pursuer the slip, and then Rowell would find
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: himself with the fool's death on his conscience, and what was to him
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: infinitely worse, with a thousand dollars in his pocket that had been
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: unfairly won. This thought made him curse Mellish afresh. It had been
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: entirely against his own will that he had played with marked cards, but
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Mellish had insisted that they should take no chances, and the veteran
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: knew too well the uncertainties of playing a fair game where a great
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: object lesson was to be taught. It would make them look like two fools,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Mellish had said, if Forme won the money. In answer to this Rowell had
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: remarked that they were two fools anyhow, but he had finally succumbed
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to Mellish as the whole scheme was Mellish's. As Rowell thought
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bitterly of these things his attention was diverted from the very
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: matter he had in hand. Few men can pursue a course of thought and a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: fellow-creature at the same time. He suddenly realized that young Forme
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: had escaped him. Rowell stood alone in the dimly-lighted silent street
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and poured unuttered maledictions on his own stupidity. Suddenly a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: voice rang out from a dark doorway.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What the devil are you following me for?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, you're there, are you?" said Pony calmly.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I'm here. Now what do you want of me? Aren't you satisfied with what
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you have done to-night?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Naturally not, or I wouldn't be fool-chasing at such an hour as this."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Then you admit you have been following me?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I never denied it."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What do you want of me? Do I belong to myself or do you think I belong
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to you, because I owe you some money?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I do not know, I am sure, to whom you belong," said Rowell with his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: slow drawl. "I suspect, however, that the city police, who seem to be
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: scarce at this hour, have the first claim upon you. What do I want of
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you? I want to ask you a question. Where did you get the money you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: played with to-night?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It's none of your business."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I presume not. But as there are no witnesses to this interesting
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: conversation I will venture an opinion that you robbed the bank."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The young man took a step forward, but Pony stood his ground, using the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: interval to light another cigarette.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I will also venture an opinion, Mr. Rowell, and say that the money
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: came as honestly into my pocket as it did into yours."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "That wouldn't be saying much for it. I have the advantage of you,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: however, because the nine points are in my favor. I have possession."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "What are you following me for? To give me up?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You admit the robbery, then."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I admit nothing."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It won't be used against you. As I told you, there are no witnesses.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: It will pay you to be frank. Where did you get the money?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Where many another man gets it. Out of the bank."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I thought so. Now, Forme, you are not such a fool as you look--or act.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: You know where all that sort of thing leads to. You haven't any chance.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: All the rules of the game are against you. You have no more show than
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you had against me to-night. Why not chuck it, before it is too late?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It is easy for you to talk like that when you have my money in your
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: pocket."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "But that simply is another rule of the game. The money of a thief is
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bound to go into someone else's pocket. Whoever enjoys the cash
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: ultimately, he never does. Now if you had the money in your pocket what
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: would you do?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I would go back to Mellish's and have another try."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I believe you," said Rowell with, for the first time, some cordiality
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: in his voice. He recognized a kindred spirit in this young man.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Nevertheless it would be a foolish thing to do. You have two chances
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: before you. You can become a sport as I am and spend your life in
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: gambling rooms. Or you can become what is called a respectable business
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: man. But you can't be both. In a very short time you will not have the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: choice. You will be found out and then you can only be what I am--
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: probably not as successful as I have been. If you add bank robbery to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: your other accomplishments then you will go to prison or, what is
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: perhaps worse, to Canada. Which career are you going to choose?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Come down to plain facts. What do you mean by all this talk? If I say
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: I'll quit gambling do you mean that you will return to me the thousand
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: dollars and call the other thousand square?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "If you give me your word of honor that you will quit."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "And if I don't, what then?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Then on Monday I will hand over this money to the bank and advise them
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to look into your accounts."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "And suppose my accounts prove to be all right, what then?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Rowell shrugged his shoulders. "In that remote possibility I will give
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the thousand dollars to you and play you another game for it."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "I see. Which means that you cheated to-night."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "If you like to put it that way."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "And what if I denounced you as a self-confessed cheat?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "It wouldn't matter to me. I wouldn't take the trouble to deny it.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Nobody would believe you."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "You're a cool hand, Pony, I admire your cheek. Still, you've got some
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: silly elements in you."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh, you mean my trying to reform you? Don't make any mistake about
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: that. It is Mellish's idea, not mine. I don't believe in you for a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: moment."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: THE RAID ON MELLISH.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Some newspapers differ from others. One peculiarity about the Argus was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the frequency with which it changed its men. Managing editors came who
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: were going to revolutionize the world and incidentally the Argus, but
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: they were in the habit of disappearing to give place to others who also
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: disappeared. Newspaper men in that part of the country never considered
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: themselves full-fledged unless they had had a turn at managing the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Argus. If you asked who was at the head of the Argus the answer would
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: very likely be: "Well, So-and-so was managing it this morning. I don't
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: know who is running it this afternoon."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Perhaps the most weird period in the history of the Argus was when the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: owners imported a crank from Pittsburg and put him in as local editor,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: over the heads of the city staff. His name was McCrasky, christened
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Angus or Archie, I forget which, at this period of time. In fact, his
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Christian name was always a moot point; some of the reporters saying it
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: was Angus and others Archie, no one having the courage to ask him.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Anyhow, he signed himself A. McCrasky. He was a good man, which was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: rather an oddity on the staff, and puzzled the reporters not a little.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Most of his predecessors had differed much from each other, but they
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: were all alike in one thing, and that was profanity. They expressed
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: disapproval in language that made the hardened printers' towel in the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: composing room shrink.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: McCrasky's great point was that the local pages of the paper should
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: have a strong moral influence on the community. He knocked the sporting
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: editor speechless by telling him that they would have no more reports
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: of prize-fights. Poor Murren went back to the local room, sat down at
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: his table and buried his head in his hands. Every man on a local staff
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: naturally thinks the paper is published mainly to give his department a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: show, and Murren considered a fight to a finish as being of more real
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: importance to the world than a presidential election. The rest of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: boys tried to cheer him up. "A fine state of things," said Murren
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: bitterly. "Think of the scrap next week between the California Duffer
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and Pigeon Billy and no report of it in the Argus! Imagine the walk-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: over for the other papers. What in thunder does he think people want to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: read?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: But there was another surprise in store for the boys. McCrasky
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: assembled them all in his room and held forth to them. He suddenly
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: sprung a question on the criminal reporter--so suddenly that Thompson,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: taken unawares, almost spoke the truth.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Do you know of any gambling houses in this city?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Thompson caught his breath and glanced quickly at Murren.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "No," he said at last. "I don't, but perhaps the religious editor does.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Better ask him."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: The religious editor smiled and removed his corn-cob pipe.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "There aren't any," he said. "Didn't you know it was against the law to
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: keep a gambling house in this state? Yes, sir!" Then he put his corn-
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: cob pipe back in its place.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: McCrasky was pleased to see that his young men knew so little of the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: wickedness of a great city; nevertheless he was there to give them some
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: information, so he said quietly:
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Certainly it is against the law; but many things that are against the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: law flourish in a city like this. Now I want you to find out before the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: week is past how many gambling houses there are and where they are
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: located. When you are sure of your facts we will organize a raid and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: the news will very likely be exclusive, for it will be late at night
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: and the other papers may not hear of it."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Suppose," said the religious editor, with a twinkle in his eye, as he
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: again removed his corn-cob, "that--assuming such places to exist--you
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: found some representatives of the other papers there? They are a bad
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: lot, the fellows on the other papers."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "If they are there," said the local editor, "they will go to prison."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "They won't mind that, if they can write something about it," said
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Murren gloomily. In his opinion the Argus was going to the dogs.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Now, Thompson," said McCrasky, "you as criminal reporter must know a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: lot of men who can give you particulars for a first-rate article on the
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

text: half, with scare heads. We must work up public opinion."

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: drawer. "Are you going to put Mellish on his guard?" he asked Thompson.
title: The Face and the Mask

text: "I don't just know what I'm going to do," said Thompson; "are you?"
title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

text: yours, Murren. Why don't you buy cut plug?"
title: The Face and the Mask

text: "You're not compelled to smoke it," said the sporting editor, without
title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

text: "I am when mine is out, and the other fellows keep their drawers
title: The Face and the Mask

text: locked."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Thompson dropped in on Mellish, the keeper of the swell gambling rooms,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: to consult with him on the article for Saturday's paper. Mellish took a
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: great interest in it, and thought it would do good. He willingly gave
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Thompson several instances where the vice had led to ruin of promising
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: young men.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "All men gamble in some way or another," said Mellish meditatively.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Some take it one way and some another. It is inherent in human nature,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: like original sin. The beginning of every business is a gamble. If I
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: had $30,000 I would rather run my chance of doubling it at these tables
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: here than I would, for instance, by starting a new newspaper or putting
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it on wheat or in railway stocks. Take a land boom, for instance, such
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: as there was in California or at Winnipeg--the difference between
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: putting your money in a thing like that or going in for legitimate
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: gambling is that, in the one case, you are sure to lose your cash,
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: while in the other you have a chance of winning some. I hold that all
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: kinds of gambling are bad, unless a man can easily afford to lose what
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: he stakes. The trouble is that gambling affects some people like
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: liquor. I knew a man once who----" but you can read the whole article if
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: you turn up the back numbers of the Argus.
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: Thompson told Mellish about McCrasky. Mellish was much interested, and
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: said he would like to meet the local editor. He thought the papers
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: should take more interest in the suppression of gambling dens than they
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: did, and for his part he said he would like to see them all stopped,
title: The Face and the Mask

text: his own included. "Of course," he added, "I could shut up my shop, but
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: it would simply mean that someone else would open another, and I don't
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: think any man ever ran such a place fairer than I do."

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: local editor of the Argus.

author: Barr, Robert

text: "Oh," said the chief, "has Gorman gone, then?"
title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

text: Finnigan. I believe he is in Cincinnati now."
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: became very official and somewhat taciturn. He presumed that there were
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: gambling houses in the city. If there were, they were very quiet and no
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: editor. He knew his way about in the office, and, finding Murren was
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: not in, he left the item on his table. Then he wandered into the local
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: editor's room. The newspaper boys all liked Hammerly, and many a good
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

text: "Yes. Sit down, Mr. Hammerly. Do you know Pittsburg at all?"
title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

text: John Crandall sat at his office desk and thought the situation over.

title: The Face and the Mask
author: Barr, Robert

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask

title: The Face and the Mask
